commit_message:
Fix invalid exception mock for InvalidNUMANodesNumber

There is a required field of "nodes" for this exception, which our
mock was not providing. This created a warning spam during test runs
(though it did not actually fail the tests).

Change-Id: Ib9521f5efe5939d470c2662d1d59e22a9ccf5ff4
(cherry picked from commit bf6280ee269e8621a4d4709e4ae7f821c753625a)

commit_message:
playbooks: roles: bifrost-ironic-install: Verify checksum for IPA files

Use the newly published checksum files to verify the integrity of the
downloaded IPA files. If verification fails, we try a few more times
before we give up since that would either mean that there is a
connectivity issue on our end or a problem with the uploaded files.
Checksum verification is enabled by default but it can be easily
disabled in case we do a non-upstream build with no checksum files
available.

Depends-On: I66afa3682ee1461ba1cdb68a134eaa4fd85af4e0
Change-Id: I7b3cad1b42e297b87ca839d66a16303250e27404
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/bifrost refs/changes/38/439938/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - block: - name: "Download IPA kernel checksum file" get_url: url="{{ ipa_kernel_upstream_url }}.sha256" dest="{{ ipa_kernel }}.sha256" timeout=300 - name: "Extract IPA kernel checksum" shell: awk '/"{{ipa_kernel_upstream_url | basename }}"/{print $1}' "{{ ipa_kernel }}.sha256" register: ipa_kernel_checksum - name: "Download IPA kernel" get_url: url: "{{ ipa_kernel_upstream_url }}" dest: "{{ ipa_kernel }}" sha256sum: "{{ ipa_kernel_checksum.stdout }}" timeout: 300 # Keep downloading it until we get a good copy force: yes register: ipa_kernel_good_checksum until: ipa_kernel_good_checksum|succeeded retries: 5 delay: 10- block: - name: "Download IPA image checksum" get_url: url="{{ ipa_ramdisk_upstream_url }}.sha256" dest="{{ ipa_ramdisk }}.sha256" timeout=300 - name: "Extract IPA ramdisk checksum" shell: awk '/"{{ipa_ramdisk_upstream_url | basename }}"/{print $1}' "{{ ipa_ramdisk }}.sha256" register: ipa_ramdisk_checksum - name: "Download IPA image" get_url: url: "{{ ipa_ramdisk_upstream_url }}" dest: "{{ ipa_ramdisk }}" sha256sum: "{{ ipa_ramdisk_checksum.stdout }}" timeout: 300 # Keep downloading it until we get a good copy force: yes register: ipa_ramdisk_good_checksum until: ipa_ramdisk_good_checksum|succeeded retries: 5 delay: 10
deleted_lines: - name: "Download IPA kernel" get_url: url={{ ipa_kernel_upstream_url }} dest={{ ipa_kernel }} timeout=300- name: "Download IPA image" get_url: url={{ ipa_ramdisk_upstream_url }} dest={{ ipa_ramdisk }} timeout=300

subject: Move heartbeat processing to separate mixin class
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-29 17:59:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/7df23fd59565732841af7fad1947b2c998a6a983', 'message': "Move heartbeat processing to separate mixin class

Ironic already exposes heartbeat endpoint in top-level,
driver-independent REST API.
As an Ironic API heartbeater can be implemented as much simpler
script/startup job than whole Ironic Python Agent inside the deploy ramdisk,
let us allow out-of-tree drivers which are not IPA-based to re-use
base ironic heartbeat processing implementation without inheriting and
having to override too much of agent_base_vendor.AgentDeployMixin class.

This patch moves the 'heartbeat' method to a separate HeartbeatMixin
class, and also provides dummy implementations of methods called from
within the 'heartbeat' method for reference.
It also sets a property 'collect_ramdisk_logs' on the driver object
to differentiate when there is indeed IPA intended to be running inside
the deploy ramdisk to collect logs from (default is True), so that
classes inheriting from this new mixin can override it.
As a side-effect, method `_refresh_clean_steps` is turned to public one
(leading underscore removed).

This change should be completely trasparent to current consumers of
ironic driver API and has no effect on them.

Change-Id: Ia7987342aef1910c5f4042604ab5076bf4e035e9
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-13 18:04:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/401432d5d3132fa40a97153a0e87a3db9cae09d3', 'message': "Move heartbeat processing to separate mixin class

let us allow out-of-tree drivers which are not IPA-based to re-use
base ironic heartbeat processing implementation as is.

This patch moves the 'heartbeat' method to a separate HeartbeatMixin
class, and also provides dummy implementations of methods called from
within the 'heartbeat' method for reference.
Drivers that do not depend on IPA but still would like to use heartbeat
functionality may inherit from this class and override self._client in
their __init__ to None or False to suppress collecting logs from
ramdisk on failure.

As a side-effect of such change, method `_refresh_clean_steps` is turned to
public one (leading underscore removed).

This change should be completely trasparent to current consumers of
ironic driver API and has no effect on them.

Change-Id: Ia7987342aef1910c5f4042604ab5076bf4e035e9

public one (leading underscore removed).

commit_message:
Move heartbeat processing to separate mixin class

Ironic already exposes heartbeat endpoint in top-level,
driver-independent REST API.
As an Ironic API heartbeater can be implemented as much simpler
script/startup job than whole Ironic Python Agent inside the deploy ramdisk,
let us allow out-of-tree drivers which are not IPA-based to re-use
base ironic heartbeat processing implementation as is.

This patch moves the 'heartbeat' method to a separate HeartbeatMixin
class, and also provides dummy implementations of methods called from
within the 'heartbeat' method for reference.
Drivers that do not depend on IPA but still would like to use heartbeat
functionality may inherit from this class and override self._client in
their __init__ to None or False to suppress collecting logs from
ramdisk on failure.

As a side-effect of such change, method `_refresh_clean_steps` is turned to
public one (leading underscore removed).

This change should be completely trasparent to current consumers of
ironic driver API and has no effect on them.

Change-Id: Ia7987342aef1910c5f4042604ab5076bf4e035e9

added_lines: class HeartbeatMixin(object): """Mixin class implementing heartbeat processing.""" @property def collect_ramdisk_logs(self): return True def refresh_clean_steps(self, task): """Refresh the node's cached clean steps :param task: a TaskManager instance """ def continue_cleaning(self, task): """Start the next cleaning step if the previous one is complete. :param task: a TaskManager instance """ @METRICS.timer('HeartbeatMixin.heartbeat') def heartbeat(self, task, callback_url): """Process a heartbeat. :param task: task to work with. :param callback_url: agent HTTP API URL. """ # TODO(dtantsur): upgrade lock only if we actually take action other # than updating the last timestamp. task.upgrade_lock() node = task.node LOG.debug('Heartbeat from node %s', node.uuid) driver_internal_info = node.driver_internal_info driver_internal_info['agent_url'] = callback_url # TODO(rloo): 'agent_last_heartbeat' was deprecated since it wasn't # being used so remove that entry if it exists. # Hopefully all nodes will have been updated by Pike, so # we can delete this code then. driver_internal_info.pop('agent_last_heartbeat', None) node.driver_internal_info = driver_internal_info node.save() # Async call backs don't set error state on their own # TODO(jimrollenhagen) improve error messages here msg = _('Failed checking if deploy is done.') try: if node.maintenance: # this shouldn't happen often, but skip the rest if it does. LOG.debug('Heartbeat from node %(node)s in maintenance mode; ' 'not taking any action.', {'node': node.uuid}) return elif (node.provision_state == states.DEPLOYWAIT and not self.deploy_has_started(task)): msg = _('Node failed to get image for deploy.') self.continue_deploy(task) elif (node.provision_state == states.DEPLOYWAIT and self.deploy_is_done(task)): msg = _('Node failed to move to active state.') self.reboot_to_instance(task) elif (node.provision_state == states.DEPLOYWAIT and self.deploy_has_started(task)): node.touch_provisioning() elif node.provision_state == states.CLEANWAIT: node.touch_provisioning() try: if not node.clean_step: LOG.debug('Node %s just booted to start cleaning.', node.uuid) msg = _('Node failed to start the first cleaning ' 'step.') # First, cache the clean steps self.refresh_clean_steps(task) # Then set/verify node clean steps and start cleaning manager_utils.set_node_cleaning_steps(task) _notify_conductor_resume_clean(task) else: msg = _('Node failed to check cleaning progress.') self.continue_cleaning(task) except exception.NoFreeConductorWorker: # waiting for the next heartbeat, node.last_error and # logging message is filled already via conductor's hook pass except Exception as e: err_info = {'node': node.uuid, 'msg': msg, 'e': e} last_error = _('Asynchronous exception for node %(node)s: ' '%(msg)s Exception: %(e)s') % err_info LOG.exception(last_error) if node.provision_state in (states.CLEANING, states.CLEANWAIT): manager_utils.cleaning_error_handler(task, last_error) elif node.provision_state in (states.DEPLOYING, states.DEPLOYWAIT): deploy_utils.set_failed_state( task, last_error, collect_logs=self.collect_ramdisk_logs) class AgentDeployMixin(HeartbeatMixin): """Mixin with deploy methods.""" def __init__(self): self._client = _get_client() @METRICS.timer('AgentDeployMixin.refresh_clean_steps') def refresh_clean_steps(self, task): self.refresh_clean_steps(task)

commit_message:
Identity V3 rbac_base method refactor

Partially-Implements bp: initial-tests-identity

Pulled out frequently used methods into rbac_base
Renamed frequently used methods to be uniformly called Setup_test_X
Cleaned up clients
Refactored relevant tests to use new Setup_test_X methods
Fixed create tests that required other resources, but were denied permission

Co-Authored-By: Felipe Monteiro <felipe.monteiro@att.com>
Co-Authored-By: Nicolas Hegleson <nicolas.helgeson@att.com>

Change-Id: I0cb55e676c1e903e5cd7ffecf3d3c53d28dedc1a
Closes-Bug: #1672248

commit_message:
Fixes Category Package Count with Murano + GLARE.

Also made following changes:
 - updated a few error messages in catalog.py
 - added test for testing category package count to
   test_catalog.py.
 - added new tempest test for verifying package_count in
   list_categories API.

Change-Id: I7ee936a46d9ae2b4b5b8c8305f2807a562bf4d39
Partial-Bug: #1656928

commit_message:
Fix enabling glance v1 for OSC

In [1] the variable GLANCE_V1_ENABLED was set at the devstack-gate
level, but it is needed in DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG instead.

[1] Icff8686b9ca68b2d2b0d78b12c4e6a4237a94bb5

Change-Id: I59cc890ae03351a2d9c62ab4c78bc854f2271963
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/00/445900/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Indicating the location tests directory in oslo_debug_helper

According to [1], we can passing a "-t" argument to
oslo_debug_helper to indicate the directory where tests
are located. This will solves ImportError exception.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslotest/features.html

Change-Id: I096d801b48dba30eb7db79c958d7431230544e62
Closes-Bug: #1666560

commit_message:
Revert "Revert "Deploy heat APIs over httpd""

With I79b7b19d8c1af6cc34875fc05800dc9da5ac7cad having merged, the issues with old images have been addressed.

This reverts commit f122ea14b8d9c91ad69248c948fa56d1e2889f67.

commit_message:
Remove support for py34 for heat

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due
to the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5
is available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: Ic7b3fb3ff7b68cf280e36335aa9cacd644cc877a

commit_message:
Pass located tests directory in oslo debug

According to [1], we can passing a "-t" argument to
oslo_debug_helper to indicate the directory where tests
are located. This will solves ImportError exception.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslotest/features.html

Closes-Bug: #1666560

Change-Id: Ia85c2b5ac21ebfdb098c1c0d8f6ac984cb2d6e4d

commit_message:
Sync deployment tasks product-way

Deployment tasks are now stored in both /etc/puppet and /etc/fuel
directories. We have to sync both directories - fortunately we can just
reuse part of fuel master node preparation
Also rewrite it for using SSHManager

Change-Id: I54402f7b8032771d9156da6937df9cfba1d6b534
Closes-bug:1673084

commit_message:
Implement container snapshot - patch 1
This patch implements the creation of a docker container snapshot at local host.
example CLI: zun commit --repository myrepo --tag mytag

Change-Id: I72c04a920bb5bd0712de5b33d6a830f61e4cd174

subject: Prevent unnecessary floating IP dissociate during updating extra attributes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-07 04:01:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn/commit/613d65de582666cb3bc25c234a82f9b30df11c81', 'message': 'Provent unnecessary floating IP dissociate during updating extra attirbutes

If try to updating extra attirbutes, such as description, the floating
IP will be dissociated from ovn dbs, which is unnecessary and causing
connection lose.

This patch adds more specific router_id(s) check in l3_ovn plugin function
update_floatingip.

Change-Id: Ia0fb12fdc34893c6ab0defa67007dc51d0f6e7d6
Closes-Bug: #1662405
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-08 10:01:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn/commit/0688a48c38da752ee104116ce824003236389452', 'message': 'Provent unnecessary floating IP dissociate during updating extra attirbutes

If try to updating extra attirbutes, such as description, the floating
IP nat rules will be removed from ovn dbs once, which is unnecessary
and causing connection lose.

This patch uses more specific floating IP port_id check in l3_ovn
plugin function update_floatingip.

Change-Id: Ia0fb12fdc34893c6ab0defa67007dc51d0f6e7d6
Closes-Bug: #1662405

commit_message:
Prevent unnecessary floating IP dissociate during updating extra attributes

If try to update extra attributes, such as description, the floating
IP nat rules will be removed from OVN DBs once, which is unnecessary
and causing connection lose.

This patch will make the floating IP association status check more
specific.

Change-Id: Ia0fb12fdc34893c6ab0defa67007dc51d0f6e7d6
Closes-Bug: #1662405

commit_message:
dsvm-functional test_dhcp_options failed in CentOS 7.3

An DHCP option assert error occurred, it only appears on CentOS 7.X
version rather than Ubuntu 16.04.
This is not a functional bug, so simply adjust the test code to repair
the failure.

Change-Id: I799cab99cdf1f5f6857aef5b4b5e80ca7c5f7d3d
Closes-bug: 1668834
Signed-off-by: Dong Jun <dongj@dtdream.com>

commit_message:
Use HostAddressOpt for store opts that accept IP and hostnames

The glance_store configuration options: ``sheepdog_store_address``
and ``vmware_server_host`` accept both IP addresses and hostnames.
Since there was no specific OSLO opt type to support this, we were
using ``StrOpt``. The change [1] that added support for
``HostAddressOpt`` type was merged in Ocata and became available for
use with oslo version 3.22.

This patch changes the opt type of these 2 glance_store configuration
options to use this more relevant opt type - HostAddressOpt.

[1] I77bdb64b7e6e56ce761d76696bc4448a9bd325eb

Change-Id: I43fec064815395b8a57e7ef21e43dcbe4d41066e

commit_message:
Add DRIVER_RESOURCE to remove duplicated strings

This cleans up the driver-related code so that the fields and labels
used for driver resources are in v1/resource_fields.py. This makes
it consistent with the other resources (node, port, etc).

Change-Id: I4d546d1ad3be997a23be4e2d9c919644bf8ce804

subject: Removal of re-switching of rbac-role from tearDown
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-13 16:42:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/patrole/commit/58399e5f363d3a9851f7ce752aecad3ae488a0b0', 'message': 'Move switch roles in tearDown to base rbac classes.

There is no need to add switch_role(switch_to_rbac_role=False) in
the tearDown method of every single Patrole test class. It is more
sensible and more maintainable to move
switch_role(switchToRbacRole=False) to every base Patrole test
class, e.g. to rbac_base.py in compute, identity, image, network
and volume project folders.

Also, the current framework only adds the admin role to
the cls.os.<client-name> namespace when switchToRbacRole=False
is executed; meaning that the first test that is executed
in a test run will not have the admin role during set up.
Thus it is necessary to add a setUp to each Patrole base
class with switchToRbacRole=False, so that, regardless of test
execution order, the first test has necessary permissions
to do set up prior to performing the RBAC test action.

This patch:
  * Moves the switchToRbacRole=False function call to every
    base Patrole test class.
  * Also performs switchToRbacRole=False in the setUp of
    every base Patrole test class.

Change-Id: I3f0026533255c87b8128f2bf3a4aa488382a2523
Implements: blueprint refactor-teardown-switch-roles
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-03-13 16:44:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/patrole/commit/5f7001dc4abc27090b147080ebf977c4f21ae8a8', 'message': 'Move switch roles in tearDown to base rbac classes.

Thus it is necessary to add a setUp to each Patrole base

This patch:

the tearDown method of every single Patrole test class. It is more
sensible and more maintainable to move
switch_role(switchToRbacRole=False) to every base Patrole test
class, e.g. to rbac_base.py in compute, identity, image, network
and volume project folders.

Also, the current framework only adds the admin role to
the cls.os.<client-name> namespace when switchToRbacRole=False
is executed; meaning that the first test that is executed
in a test run will not have the admin role during set up.

Thus, it is necessary to add a switch_role with
switchToRbacRole=False to setup_clients (after rbac_utils
is instantiated), so that class-level resources are set
up with admin credentials. This is why

commit_message:
Removal of re-switching of rbac-role from tearDown

Currently, for every test case class, we need to add
re-switching rbac role in tearDown method. Thus for
every testcase using the tearDown method becomes
mandatory.

This patch removes tearDown dependency for re-switching
rbac-role.

Co-Authored-By: Mh Raies <mh.raies@ericsson.com>
Co-Authored-By: Felipe Monteiro <felipe.monteiro@att.com>

Implements: blueprint refactor-teardown-switch-roles
Change-Id: I3f0026533255c87b8128f2bf3a4aa488382a2523
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/patrole refs/changes/94/444994/15 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: def tearDown(self): self.rbac_utils.switch_role(self, switchToRbacRole=False) super(ExtensionsRbacTest, self).tearDown()

commit_message:
Fix service-list command for API v.3.0-3.6

Commit I90a2b713556e91db69270a03ef6b798e08f93f90 introduced an issue
with service-list command. It was broken for version from 3.0 to 3.6

Change-Id: I0febcb5debdbe157febfd1d1796e716897bde33d
Closes-Bug: #1672705

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-15 15:09:19.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/153cc460bbb7f0e22e2e18b894a149d7a29ac57f', 'message': "Disable functional tests for nodepool gearman-zk-shim

They only test features that we're removing from the shim, so don't
bother running the jobs. Also, we don't care about code coverage, so
don't waste time on it. Also, we don't publish docs for it, so don't run
those either.

Change-Id: Ia3969c950d511d39e944b94509070c79764e4389
"}]
commit_message:
Disable functional tests for nodepool gearman-zk-shim

They only test features that we're removing from the shim, so don't
bother running the jobs. Also, we don't care about code coverage, so
don't waste time on it. Also, we don't publish docs for it, so don't run
those either.

Change-Id: Ia3969c950d511d39e944b94509070c79764e4389
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/03/446003/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Disable devstack tests on the zk-shim branch of nodepool - name: ^gate-dsvm-nodepool branch: ^(?!feature/gearman-zk-shim).*$ # Disable coverage tests on the zk-shim branch of nodepool - name: nodepool-coverage-ubuntu-xenial branch: ^(?!feature/gearman-zk-shim).*$ # Disable docs jobs on the zk-shim branch of nodepool - name: gate-nodepool-docs-ubuntu-xenial branch: ^(?!feature/gearman-zk-shim).*$

subject: Add PD support in HA router
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-20 15:25:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/8af144a93b56fc8e9740ebf837429f8cdba4dceb', 'message': '[WIP] Add PD support in HA router

the following enhancements are added:
  -- PD keeps track of status of neutron routers: active, standby,
     standalone.
  -- PD DHCP clients are only spawned in the active router. in the
     standby router, PD keeps track of the assigned prefixes, but
     doesn't spawn DHCP clients.
  -- When switchover occurs, on the router becoming standby, PD
     clients are "killed" so that they don't send prefix withdraw to
     the DHCP server. On the router becoming active, PD spawns DHCP
     clients with the assigned prefixes configured as hints in the
     DHCP client's configuration

Closes-Bug: #1651465
Change-Id: I17df98128c7a88e72e31251687f30f569df6b860
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-20 19:06:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/9a468e130a37cac235ae37a5df21080ce576222b', 'message': '[WIP] Add PD support in HA router

commit_message:
Add PD support in HA router

The following enhancements are added:
  -- PD keeps track of status of neutron routers: active or
     standalone (master), or standby (not master),
  -- PD DHCP clients are only spawned in the active router. In the
     standby router, PD keeps track of the assigned prefixes, but
     doesn't spawn DHCP clients.
  -- When switchover occurs, on the router becoming standby, PD
     clients are "killed" so that they don't send prefix withdrawals
     to the DHCP server. On the router becoming active, PD spawns DHCP
     clients with the assigned prefixes configured as hints in the
     DHCP client's configuration

Closes-Bug: #1651465
Change-Id: I17df98128c7a88e72e31251687f30f569df6b860

commit_message:
Add ironic::drivers::interfaces class

This patch adds a new class ironic::drivers::interfaces that
will configure interfaces on ironic conductor side.
This patch allows to configure enabled_network_interfaces field.

Depends-On: I67495196c3334f51ed034f4ca6e32a3e01a58f15
Change-Id: I8ea64b23eb476cedf47527e1659174d51905eb23
Related-Bug: #1526403
(cherry picked from commit d991f285e8554828e29353393253ff4a04077bfb)

commit_message:
Fallback to the first subnet inside the pool

In ipam_request_address, if there multiple subnets inside the
subnetpool and none of the subnets has a matching cidr, pick the
first subnet and print a warning. Otherwise, an error will raise
for complaining no subnet was found, which is suboptimal.

In addition, there is a minor cleanup on the unit test.

Change-Id: Ia668b36b4781b65928c227d61b3baff12147ff00
Related-Bug: #1665039

commit_message:
Update MidoNet plugin manifest

The MidoNet API no longer exists with that name. We are deprecating its
parameters and replacing them by its counterpart "cluster".

Also the dependency python-networking-midonet-ext package is removed as
this is only needed for the N release. Will be added when backported.

Change-Id: Ia85bc41c05d766f995835941ed5fc46ce5465334
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/94/428694/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # (DEPRECATED) IP address of the MidoNet API service. # Defaults to undef ## (DEPRECATED) Port on which the MidoNet API service listens. # Defaults to undef # # [*midonet_cluster_ip*] # IP address of the MidoNet Cluster service. # Defaults to '127.0.0.1' # # [*midonet_cluster_port*] # Port on which the MidoNet Cluster listens. # Defaults to '8181' ## Username with which MidoNet Cluster will authenticate against Keystone. # Defaults to 'neutron' ## Password for the user that will be used to authenticate against Keystone.## Tenant for the user that will be used to authenticate against Keystone. # Defaults to 'services' ## Whether 'midonet-db-manage' should run to create and/or sync the database # with MidoNet specific tables. # Defaults to false# Defaults to false# Whether to install the latest package, or a specific version # of the MidoNet plugin. # Defaults to 'present'# midonet_cluster_ip => '23.123.5.32', # midonet_cluster_port => '8080', # keystone_username => 'neutron', # keystone_password => '32kjaxT0k3na', # keystone_tenant => 'services', # sync_db => true# neutron::plugin::midonet::midonet_cluster_ip: '23.213.5.32' # neutron::plugin::midonet::port: '8181'# neutron::plugin::midonet::keystone_password: '32kjaxT0k3na' $midonet_api_ip = undef, $midonet_api_port = undef, $midonet_cluster_ip = '127.0.0.1', $midonet_cluster_port = '8181', $keystone_username = 'neutron', $keystone_password = $::os_service_default, $keystone_tenant = 'service', $sync_db = false, $purge_config = false, $package_ensure = 'present' if $midonet_api_ip { # If we got midonet_api_ip here, display deprecation warning and use this value. warning('The midonet_api_ip parameter is going to be removed in future releases. Use the midonet_cluster_ip parameter instead.') cluster_ip = $midonet_api_ip } else { cluster_ip = $midonet_cluster_ip } if $midonet_api_port { # If we got midonet_api_port here, display deprecation warning and use this value. warning('The midonet_api_port parameter is going to be removed in future releases. Use the midonet_cluster_port parameter instead.') cluster_port = $midonet_api_port } else { cluster_port = $midonet_cluster_port } ensure_resource('file', '/etc/neutron/plugins/midonet', { ensure => directory, owner => 'root', group => 'neutron', mode => '0640' } neutron_plugin_midonet { 'MIDONET/midonet_uri': value => "http://${cluster_ip}:${cluster_port}/midonet-api";
deleted_lines: # IP address of the MidoNet api service# IP address of the MidoNet port service. MidoNet runs in a Tomcat, so 8080 # is used by default.# Username from which midonet api will authenticate against Keystone (neutron # service is desirable and defaulted)# Password from which midonet api will authenticate against Keystone# Tenant from which midonet api will authenticate against Keystone (services # tenant is desirable and defaulted)# Whether 'midonet-db-manage' should run to create and/or syncrhonize the database # with MidoNet specific tables. Defaults to false# Defaults to false.# Whether to install the latest package, or a version for midonet plugin # Defaults to 'present'.# midonet_api_ip => '23.123.5.32', # midonet_api_port => '8080', # keystone_username => 'neutron', # keystone_password => '32kjaxT0k3na', # keystone_tenant => 'services', # sync_db => true# neutron::plugin::midonet::midonet_api_ip: '23.213.5.32' # neutron::plugin::midonet::port: '8080'# neutron::plugin::midonet::keystone_password: '32.kjaxT0k3na' $midonet_api_ip = '127.0.0.1', $midonet_api_port = '8080', $keystone_username = 'neutron', $keystone_password = $::os_service_default, $keystone_tenant = 'services', $sync_db = false, $purge_config = false, $package_ensure = 'present' ensure_resource('file', '/etc/neutron/plugins/midonet', { ensure => directory, owner => 'root', group => 'neutron', mode => '0640'} package { 'python-networking-midonet-ext': ensure => $package_ensure, name => $::neutron::params::midonet_server_package_ext, tag => ['neutron-package', 'openstack'], } neutron_plugin_midonet { 'MIDONET/midonet_uri': value => "http://${midonet_api_ip}:${midonet_api_port}/midonet-api"; Package<| title == 'python-networking-midonet-ext' |> ~> Exec['midonet-db-sync']

subject: Make decision wheter to build images in CI or not
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-06 19:41:09.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/to_build'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci/commit/2b18e6617c23ec606a8b188b55443625090b25b3', 'message': "Make decision wheter to build images in CI or not

Instead of using canusecache function, make a script that could
be used by quickstart to determine quickly if we need to build
image or download ready from mirror server.
Usages:
    - bash: if $(to_build); then ...
    - ansible: when: {{ lookup('pipe', 'path/to/to_build')|bool }}

Change-Id: Id5aefcf588ef984be6de07e4c7e76b5a4c5e93ad
"}]
commit_message:
Make decision wheter to build images in CI or not

Instead of using canusecache function, make a script that could
be used by quickstart to determine quickly if we need to build
image or download ready from mirror server.
Usages:
    - bash: if $(to_build); then ...
    - ansible: when: {{ lookup('pipe', 'path/to/to_build')|bool }}

Change-Id: Id5aefcf588ef984be6de07e4c7e76b5a4c5e93ad
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/39/442139/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash function set_env { export TO_BUILD=$1 echo $TO_BUILD exit } # If we are uploading to the cache then we shouldn't use it [[ "$CACHEUPLOAD" == 1 ]] && set_env "true" # The updates job already takes a long time, always use cache for it [[ "$TOCI_JOBTYPE" =~ updates ]] && set_env "false" # There are some projects that require images building for PROJFULLREF in ${ZUUL_CHANGES//^/ }; do PROJ=${PROJFULLREF%%:*}; PROJ=${PROJ##*/}; [[ "$PROJ" =~ diskimage-builder|tripleo-image-elements|tripleo-puppet-elements|instack-undercloud|python-tripleoclient|tripleo-common ]] && set_env "true" done set_env "false"

commit_message:
Added tempest_version in validate-tempest role

* we can also set tempest_version so that we can either
  test tempest against a particular tag or particular commit
  hash.

Change-Id: I4cca7c7eff5c12cc1e1d31489f2f0304864a0d64

commit_message:
pbr.version.VersionInfo needs package name (oslo.xyz and not oslo_xyz)

 We need to pass into VersionInfo what one would expect from running:
 setup.py --name

 Right now we pass in say oslo_context and pbr fails if there is no .git in
  the python source tree

  Closes-Bug: #1662266

Change-Id: I45d2edddfd516f65e1589e9b7816f1256e3f0d24
(cherry picked from commit f33bb02c8239eed78c7e9ef2f45cef5c271bee75)

commit_message:
heat: don't manage orchestration with openrc file

The orchestration should be managed in puppet-keystone, not here.
We are changing it here:
https://review.openstack.org/445681

Change-Id: I0bafdf747405ec9fb3375a32c0660586c64fa316

commit_message:
Add cAdvisor host plugin

Queries a given cAdvisor instance for host metrics. This is useful
when the agent in running in a container and does not have access
to all host level metrics

Taken from original review https://review.openstack.org/#/c/391559/

Change-Id: Ifc3d514e5256bdbc6089ec653065348a488f7c57
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/monasca-agent refs/changes/29/427329/17 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # (C) Copyright 2017 Hewlett Packard Enterprise Development LP import requests from monasca_agent.collector.checks import AgentCheck from monasca_agent.collector.checks import utils DEFAULT_TIMEOUT = "3" METRICS = { "cpu_metrics": { "system": ("system_time", ["gauge", "rate"]), "total": ("total_time", ["gauge", "rate"]), "user": ("user_time", ["gauge", "rate"]) }, "memory_metrics": { "rss": ("rss_bytes", ["gauge"]), "swap": ("swap_bytes", ["gauge"]), "cache": ("cache_bytes", ["gauge"]), "usage": ("used_bytes", ["gauge"]), "failcnt": ("fail_count", ['gauge']) }, "filesystem_metrics": { "capacity": ('total_bytes', ['gauge']), "usage": ('usage_bytes', ['gauge']) }, "diskio_metrics": { "Read": ('read_bytes', ['gauge', 'rate']), 'Write': ('write_bytes', ['gauge', 'rate']) }, 'network_metrics': { "rx_bytes": ('in_bytes', ['gauge', 'rate']), "tx_bytes": ('out_bytes', ['gauge', 'rate']), "rx_packets": ('in_packets', ['gauge', 'rate']), "tx_packets": ('out_packets', ['gauge', 'rate']), "rx_dropped": ('in_dropped_packets', ['gauge', 'rate']), "tx_dropped": ('out_dropped_packets', ['gauge', 'rate']), "rx_errors": ('in_errors', ['gauge', 'rate']), "tx_errors": ('out_errors', ['gauge', 'rate']) } } class Cadvisor(AgentCheck): """Queries given cAdvisor API for node metrics """ def __init__(self, name, init_config, agent_config, instances=None): AgentCheck.__init__(self, name, init_config, agent_config, instances) if instances is not None and len(instances) > 1: raise Exception('cAdvisor host check only supports one configured instance.') self.connection_timeout = int(init_config.get('connection_timeout', DEFAULT_TIMEOUT)) self.cadvisor_url = None def check(self, instance): if not self.cadvisor_url: cadvisor_url = instance.get("cadvisor_url", None) detect_cadvisor_url = instance.get("kubernetes_detect_cadvisor", False) if not cadvisor_url: if detect_cadvisor_url: kubernetes_connector = utils.KubernetesConnector() host = kubernetes_connector.get_agent_pod_host(self.connection_timeout) cadvisor_url = "{}:{}".format(host, "4194") else: exception_message = "Either cAdvisor url or kubernetes detect cAdvisor must be set when " \ "monitoring a Kubernetes Node." self.log.exception(exception_message) raise exception_message self.cadvisor_url = "{}:{}".format(cadvisor_url, "api/v2.0/stats?count=1") dimensions = self._set_dimensions(None, instance) try: host_metrics = self._get_metrics() except Exception as e: self.log.error("Error communicating with cAdvisor to collect data - {}".format(e)) else: self._report_metrics(host_metrics, dimensions) def _get_result(self, request_url): result = requests.get(request_url, self.connection_timeout) return result.json() def _send_metrics(self, metric_name, value, dimensions, metric_types): for metric_type in metric_types: if metric_type == 'rate': self.rate(metric_name + "_sec", value, dimensions) elif metric_type == 'gauge': self.gauge(metric_name, value, dimensions) def _parse_memory(self, memory_data, dimensions): memory_metrics = METRICS['memory_metrics'] for cadvisor_key, (metric_name, metric_types) in memory_metrics.iteritems(): if cadvisor_key in memory_data: self._send_metrics("mem." + metric_name, memory_data[cadvisor_key], dimensions, metric_types) def _parse_filesystem(self, filesystem_data, dimensions): filesystem_metrics = METRICS['filesystem_metrics'] for filesystem in filesystem_data: file_dimensions = dimensions.copy() file_dimensions['device'] = filesystem['device'] for cadvisor_key, (metric_name, metric_types) in filesystem_metrics.iteritems(): if cadvisor_key in filesystem: self._send_metrics("fs." + metric_name, filesystem[cadvisor_key], file_dimensions, metric_types) def _parse_diskio(self, diskio_data, dimensions): diskio_metrics = METRICS['filesystem_metrics'] disk_io = diskio_data['io_service_bytes'][0]['stats'] for cadvisor_key, (metric_name, metric_types) in diskio_metrics.iteritems(): if cadvisor_key in disk_io: self._send_metrics("io." + metric_name, disk_io[cadvisor_key], dimensions, metric_types) def _parse_network(self, network_data, dimensions): network_interfaces = network_data['interfaces'] network_metrics = METRICS['network_metrics'] for interface in network_interfaces: network_dimensions = dimensions.copy() network_dimensions['interface'] = interface['name'] for cadvisor_key, (metric_name, metric_types) in network_metrics.iteritems(): if cadvisor_key in interface: self._send_metrics("net." + metric_name, interface[cadvisor_key], network_dimensions, metric_types) def _parse_cpu(self, cpu_data, dimensions): cpu_metrics = METRICS['cpu_metrics'] cpu_usage = cpu_data['usage'] for cadvisor_key, (metric_name, metric_types) in cpu_metrics.iteritems(): if cadvisor_key in cpu_usage: self._send_metrics("cpu." + metric_name, cpu_usage[cadvisor_key], dimensions, metric_types) def _parse_send_metrics(self, metrics, dimensions): for host, cadvisor_metrics in metrics.iteritems(): host_dimensions = dimensions.copy() # Grab first set of metrics from return data cadvisor_metrics = cadvisor_metrics[0] if cadvisor_metrics['has_memory'] and cadvisor_metrics['memory']: self._parse_memory(cadvisor_metrics['memory'], host_dimensions) if cadvisor_metrics['has_filesystem'] and cadvisor_metrics['filesystem']: self._parse_filesystem(cadvisor_metrics['filesystem'], host_dimensions) if cadvisor_metrics['has_diskio'] and cadvisor_metrics['diskio']: self._parse_diskio(cadvisor_metrics['diskio'], host_dimensions) if cadvisor_metrics['has_network'] and cadvisor_metrics['network']: self._parse_network(cadvisor_metrics['network'], host_dimensions) if cadvisor_metrics['has_cpu'] and cadvisor_metrics['cpu']: self._parse_cpu(cadvisor_metrics['cpu'], host_dimensions)

caused by missing a pair of parentheses.

subject: Send out notifications when instance tags changed
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-06 08:44:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs/commit/1f8751594fe5a28ea91e9e831327533806bf7987', 'message': 'Send out notifications when instance tags chaned

Tag instance was added in microversion 2.26, tags have a separate
DB table and it is only related to the instance only by instance
uuid. Currently, when instance tag added, updated or deleted,no
notification will be send out. Other services like Searchlight
and Ceilometer have no way to know this information except call
instance/detail API.

Since tags are designed to be used for filter instances, and
up-to-date sync really matters for services that provide advanced
search like Searchlight,

This spec propose to add notification for tags actions.

Change-Id: Ia1e736385ce32ebc7ac0ea8f0af6a75b74eb6c68
Blueprint: send-tag-notification
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-03-03 02:38:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs/commit/375652a751695a5354b059e5125567f40f44a23c', 'message': 'Send out notifications when instance tags chaned

Tag instance was added in microversion 2.26, tags have a separate
DB table and it is only related to the instance only by instance
uuid. Currently, when instance tag added, updated or deleted,no
notification will be send out. Other services like Searchlight
and Ceilometer have no way to know this information except call
instance/detail API.

Since tags are designed to be used for filter instances, and
up-to-date sync really matters for services that provide advanced
search like Searchlight,

This spec propose to add notification for tags actions.

Change-Id: Ia1e736385ce32ebc7ac0ea8f0af6a75b74eb6c68
Blueprint: send-tag-notification
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2017-03-14 06:51:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs/commit/0e9f7f9c78c8068b2348611c93638be4474417a9', 'message': 'Send out notifications when instance tags chaned

Tag instance was added in microversion 2.26, tags have a separate
DB table and it is only related to the instance only by instance
uuid. Currently, when instance tag added, updated or deleted,no
notification will be send out. Other services like Searchlight
and Ceilometer have no way to know this information except call
instance/detail API.

Since tags are designed to be used for filter instances, and
up-to-date sync really matters for services that provide advanced

commit_message:
Send out notifications when instance tags changed

Tag instance was added in microversion 2.26, tags have a separate
DB table and it is only related to the instance only by instance
uuid. Currently, when instance tag added, updated or deleted,no
notification will be send out. Other services like Searchlight
have no way to know this information except call instance/detail API.

Since tags are designed to be used for filter instances, and
up-to-date sync really matters for services that provide advanced
search like Searchlight,

This spec propose to add notification for tags actions.

Change-Id: Ia1e736385ce32ebc7ac0ea8f0af6a75b74eb6c68
Blueprint: send-tag-notification
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/69/429569/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ================================ Notifications on tags operations ================================ https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/send-tag-notification Nova currently does not send notifications on tag create/update/delete operations. Tags are designed to be used for searching and filtering, without up-to-date tag information, services like OpenStack Searchlight will not be able to work effectively and correctly. It would be useful to receive create, update and delete notifications on any of instance tags information changing, and the payload should contain the same information for create and update as accessible from the API. Problem description =================== Use Cases --------- An external system like Searchlight[1] wants to index the instance tags which makes the query for large number of instances using instance tags faster, efficient and accurate. This will allow powerful querying as well unified search across openstack resources. The maintainer wants to get the notifications when there are tags added to, updated or destroyed from instances. Proposed change =============== Versioned notifications will be added for the following actions: * Tags.update * Tags.update_all * Tags.delete * Tags.delete_all Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- No database schema change is needed. The following new object will be added to tags for update, update_all, delete and delete_all. .. code-block:: python @base.NovaObjectRegistry.register class TagsNotification(notification.NotificationBase): # Version 1.0: Initial version VERSION = '1.0' fields = { 'payload': fields.ObjectField('TagsPayload') } @base.NovaObjectRegistry.register class TagsPayload(notification.NotificationPayloadBase): # Version 1.0: Initial version SCHEMA = { 'id': ('flavor', 'flavorid'), 'name': ('flavor', 'name'), 'ram': ('flavor', 'memory_mb'), 'vcpus': ('flavor', 'vcpus'), 'disk': ('flavor', 'root_gb'), 'ephemeral': ('flavor', 'ephemeral_gb'), 'swap': ('flavor', 'swap'), 'rxtx_factor': ('flavor', 'rxtx_factor'), 'vcpu_weight': ('flavor', 'vcpu_weight'), 'disabled': ('flavor', 'disabled'), 'is_public': ('flavor', 'is_public'), 'extra_specs': ('flavor', 'extra_specs'), 'projects': ('flavor', 'projects'), } VERSION = '1.0' fields = { 'id': fields.StringField(), 'name': fields.StringField(nullable=True), 'ram': fields.IntegerField(), 'vcpus': fields.IntegerField(), 'disk': fields.IntegerField(), 'ephemeral': fields.IntegerField(), 'swap': fields.IntegerField(), 'rxtx_factor': fields.FloatField(nullable=True), 'vcpu_weight': fields.IntegerField(nullable=True), 'disabled': fields.BooleanField(), 'is_public': fields.BooleanField(), 'extra_specs': fields.DictOfStringsField(), 'projects': fields.ListOfStringsField(), } def __init__(self, flavor): super(TagsPayload, self).__init__() self.populate_schema(tags=tags) The following new object will be added to tags for destroy: .. code-block:: python @base.NovaObjectRegistry.register class TagsDestroyNotification(notification.NotificationBase): # Version 1.0: Initial version VERSION = '1.0' fields = { 'payload': fields.ObjectField('TagsDestroyPayload') } @base.NovaObjectRegistry.register class TagsDestroyPayload(notification.NotificationPayloadBase): # Version 1.0: Initial version SCHEMA = { 'id': ('flavor', 'flavorid'), } VERSION = '1.0' fields = { 'id': fields.StringField(), } def __init__(self, flavor): super(TagsDestroyPayload, self).__init__() self.populate_schema(flavor=flavor) The definition of NotificationBase can be found [2]. REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- New notifications for tags different actions will be emitted to a amqp topic called 'versioned_notifications'. Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ Notifications will be emitted if the versioned notification is enabled. Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Kevin Zheng Work Items ---------- * Add versioned notifications for instance tags Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Besides unit test new functional test cases will be added to cover the new notifications and the tests will assert the validity of the stored notification samples as well. Documentation Impact ==================== None References ========== [1]: Searchlight: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/searchlight/index.html [2]: Versioned notification: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/nova/notifications.html#versioned-notifications History ======= .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release Name - Description * - Pike - Introduced

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-23 20:14:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/ea6b76fd4110a31d2fa863c3d9a88d7b007b297d', 'message': "placement: ironic inventory reporting

This patch adds a new virt driver API method called get_inventory() that
takes the nodename as a parameter and returns a dict, keyed by resource
class, of inventory information. The only virt driver that has an
implementation of the new get_inventory() method is the Ironic virt
driver, which, in this patch, returns both the legacy VCPU, MEMORY_MB
and DISK_GB resource classes as well as the new custom resource class
for the Ironic node, if present.

The resource tracker's _update() method was modified to first call the
virt driver get_inventory() method to get a Placement-aligned dictionary
of inventory/resource information and call a new
set_inventory_for_provider() method on the scheduler reporting client.
If the get_inventory() method is not implemented by the virt driver,
then the resource tracker falls back to calling the existing
update_resource_stats() scheduler reporting client method which analyses
the compute node object and constructs an inventory dict that the
placement API understands.

Change-Id: I4ac9dd6798576e5a9bb872d03dd2713053c39b68
blueprint: custom-resource-classes-pike

commit_message:
placement: ironic inventory reporting

This patch adds a new virt driver API method called get_inventory() that
takes the nodename as a parameter and returns a dict, keyed by resource
class, of inventory information. The only virt driver that has an
implementation of the new get_inventory() method is the Ironic virt
driver, which, in this patch, returns both the legacy VCPU, MEMORY_MB
and DISK_GB resource classes as well as the new custom resource class
for the Ironic node, if present.

The resource tracker's _update() method was modified to first call the
virt driver get_inventory() method to get a Placement-aligned dictionary
of inventory/resource information and call a new
set_inventory_for_provider() method on the scheduler reporting client.
If the get_inventory() method is not implemented by the virt driver,
then the resource tracker falls back to calling the existing
update_resource_stats() scheduler reporting client method which analyses
the compute node object and constructs an inventory dict that the
placement API understands.

For Ironic, because of the contract we have with the Ironic team, this
code auto-creates custom resource classes that come in from the Ironic
virt driver from the node's resource_class attribute. For all other
drivers, we do not auto-create resource classes in the placement API.

Note that we DO NOT yet *consume* the custom resource class inventory
during instance_claim() against an Ironic node. Once flavors are
modified to have the "resources:$CUSTOM_RESOURCE_CLASS=1" extra spec and
the scheduler will construct a request to consume *only* the custom
resource class, at that point we will correct the allocation records for
Ironic resource providers.

Change-Id: I4ac9dd6798576e5a9bb872d03dd2713053c39b68
blueprint: custom-resource-classes-pike
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/02/437602/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self._update(context, cn) self._update(context, cn) self._update(context, cn) # We short-circuit entirely if the virt driver says the node isn't # available. This is slightly different that the disabled() method, # which also takes into account whether the compute node has been # created and stored in the cache of compute node objects after # _init_compute_node() is called. nodename = resources['hypervisor_hostname'] if not self.driver.node_is_available(nodename): return nodename = compute_node.hypervisor_hostname compute_node.save() try: inv_data = self.driver.get_inventory(nodename) self.scheduler_client.set_inventory_for_provider( compute_node.uuid, compute_node.hypervisor_hostname, inv_data, ) except NotImplementedError: self.scheduler_client.update_compute_node(compute_node)

subject: Improve logs for the root device hints mechanism
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-08 14:51:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic-lib/commit/c68252c5c2a5fdada3d2fb0110e1fe635a44275e', 'message': "Add a debug log when comparing root device hints

Troubleshooting the root device hints mechanism can be tricky, most
because the rules can be complex and the machine could have many disks.
One thing that was missing was to have a log right before we try to
match the values that was passed to Ironic against the value of the disk
attribute and that's the log this patch is adding.

Change-Id: I7c5a12436d1ebbd418487ec7a28585a500022c61

commit_message:
Improve logs for the root device hints mechanism

Troubleshooting the root device hints mechanism is not trivial, mostly
because the rules for the hints can be complex and also the machine
could have many disks.

This patch is an attempt to improve the logs by:

* Change the level of some of the logs where it makes sense
* Add a debug log right before the actual comparison happen
* Log the device's name (a.k.a path, e.g: /dev/sda) instead of the
  object instance str representation, which doesn't make sense in
  the logs.

Closes-Bug: #1671416
Change-Id: I7c5a12436d1ebbd418487ec7a28585a500022c61

commit_message:
Fix for failure caused by missing primary creds

cls.os_adm is managed by 'admin' credentials.
cls.alt_os is managed by 'alt' credentilas.
Similarly, cls.os is managed by 'primary' credentials.

Currently, in test_volume_transfers_rbac.py file, it is evaluating
clients with cls.os without providing 'primary' credentials.
Because of this, failure is coming.

This patch provides fix for this.

Closes-Bug: #1672859
Change-Id: I6b6fcdc493c1c401d9851d01d7ccd05e199a4cd0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/patrole refs/changes/66/445966/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix for failure caused due to volume api version 3

Volume v3 tests are failing because for api version 3 handling
for volume clients is not done in setup clients.

This patch provides fix for this.

Closes-Bug: #1672863
Change-Id: I31b8bbadeef7e043e271f5de9f0228e7bd742181

commit_message:
Include git clone for packages in requirements

Currently if there is a package in requirements which
needs to be built from one of the git clones, it will
not work unless the related host group is populated.
This is due to the fact that the selective git clone
hinges on the host group population.

This patch adds an extra check for each git clone to
validate whether the package is in the requirements
list too. If it is, then it will clone the git source
regardless of the host group population.

Change-Id: Id121a1bcd91f688c8fab41de0b74b5b8196f8b44
Closes-Bug: #1671958

commit_message:
Adopt operation for nova server profile

This adds the operation support for adopting an existing server.
There are still some items we cannot get from nova server, due to Nova
API limitations, but the current support should be okay for most use
cases if users don't care much about 'user_data'.

Change-Id: Iaca7a5f5ab8cc4aad6707f5a1148457874d415ea

commit_message:
fix mail sending

Correct the logic related to parsing the server address so that the
default is not overwritten if there is no @ in the address.

Fix handling of a missing password by allowing an empty string to mean
no password was given.

Move the TO parsing out of the try/finally block so that errors in
parsing the message are not swallowed by errors when we quit a server
connection that wasn't opened properly.

Change-Id: I73a24a4d87c0f4a5aabd302d8a7d2884e5513c31
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Revert "Generate index file containing oslo.log messages for all tests"

This reverts commit cfd47928ffa469656192a4cc12b7547fb01ed69e.

This patch, with I5a75cc582dca48defafb440207d10e2f7b4f218b that
started to log some lines with null-bytes, triggered os-log-merger
failures that render all functional gate job runs failed.

Change-Id: If145d487b4aff732e10599b8fb98943032390411

deleted_lines: function generate_log_index { local xtrace xtrace=$(set +o | grep xtrace) set +o xtrace virtualenv /tmp/os-log-merger /tmp/os-log-merger/bin/pip install -U os-log-merger==1.0.6 files=$(find /opt/stack/logs/$venv-logs -name '*.txt' -o -name '*.log') # -a3 to truncate common path prefix contents=$(/tmp/os-log-merger/bin/os-log-merger -a3 $files) # don't store DEBUG level messages because they are not very useful, # and are not indexed by logstash anyway echo "$contents" | grep -v DEBUG | sudo tee /opt/stack/logs/$venv-index.txt > /dev/null $xtrace } generate_log_index

subject: Trim rally scenario sizes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-15 00:12:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/44cdb3f7536071c15de3f7dacc94053157071f96', 'message': 'Trim rally scenario sizes

During a normal run, the top three scenarios account for slightly
more than a half hour of runtime. Sample numbers:

Scenario                                    Load Duration Full Duration
NeutronNetworks.create_and_update_subnets       562.189   1,182.400
NeutronTrunks.create_and_list_trunk_subports    427.475    600.721
NeutronNetworks.create_and_list_ports           310.167    540.144

This patch reduces the resources created by each of the 3 by 75%. This
should save us an additional ~20 minutes during a normal gate run, which
should change our window for timeout from approximately a half hour on a
normal node to about 50 minutes.

This additional buffer should hopefully be enough to reduce the failure
rate for the rally job when it gets scheduled to a slow node.

Change-Id: I923b625f7dd3ebf794b6a9e097f5ed12ce446bb5

commit_message:
Trim rally scenario sizes

During a normal run, the top three scenarios account for slightly
more than a half hour of runtime. Sample numbers:

Scenario                                    Load Duration Full Duration
NeutronNetworks.create_and_update_subnets       562.189   1,182.400
NeutronTrunks.create_and_list_trunk_subports    427.475    600.721
NeutronNetworks.create_and_list_ports           310.167    540.144

This patch reduces the resources created by each of the 3 by 75%. This
should save us an additional ~20 minutes during a normal gate run, which
should change our window for timeout from approximately a half hour on a
normal node to about 50 minutes.

This additional buffer should hopefully be enough to reduce the failure
rate for the rally job when it gets scheduled to a slow node.

Change-Id: I923b625f7dd3ebf794b6a9e097f5ed12ce446bb5

commit_message:
conf: Fix invalid rST comments

These were breaking the openstack-docs-tools build, which is used to
build the central config guide. We should probably add a unit tests to
ensure all config options use valid (or at least, error-free) rST, but
that's a job for another day.

Change-Id: I28a5df801fa594180ab374569f06791f05938ba2

commit_message:
Update installation instructions to include stable/ocata branch

This change updates the undercloud installation and overcloud
basic command line installation instructions to include repos
for the stable branch of Ocata.

It appears that all the required information for upgrading from
Newton to Ocata already appears in the post_deployment/upgrading
document, but this should probably be reviewed.

Change-Id: I7843c45ec860dcda43fe57433c04a8d0cc24b021

commit_message:
Temporarily untarget context when deleting from cell0

When deleting an instance we look it up in the _get_instance
method and if it's in cell0 then the context is permanently
targeted to that cell via the set_target_cell method.

When we delete the instance in _delete we need to temporarily
untarget the context when we decrement the quota usage otherwise
the quota usage gets decremented in the cell0 database rather than
the cell database. Once the instance is deleted then we
re-apply the target cell on the context.

Change-Id: I7de87dce216835729283bca69f0eff59a679b624
Closes-Bug: #1670627
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/03/443403/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # TODO(mriedem): This is a hack until we have quotas in the # API database. When we looked up the instance in # _get_instance if the instance has a mapping then the # context is modified to set the target cell permanently. # However, if the instance is in cell0 then the context # is targeting cell0 and the quotas would be decremented # from cell0 and we actually need them decremented from # the cell database. So we temporarily untarget the # context while we do the quota stuff and re-target after # we're done. original_db_connection = getattr(context, 'db_connection', None) context.db_connection = None # Now the context will be temporarily mutated back to # the cell from which we want to delete the instance. finally: # Now re-target the context. context.db_connection = original_db_connection

subject: Add DHCP requests allowing ACL rule for OVN native DHCP
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-08 11:03:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn/commit/198fd3cf7486c84f5372703ecee7097c14cbc58c', 'message': "Add dhcp allowing rule to ACL for native dhcp

When creating security group rules based on remote security group, VM
can not acquire a DHCP IP. We need to add DHCP allowing rules to ACL
like OVS agent because OVN doesn't do this.

Change-Id: I6213009cd4e8c01cfaf6de7e57e5644662bc34c4

commit_message:
Add DHCP requests allowing ACL rule for OVN native DHCP

Delete default egress security group rule and add a new one with
--remote-group, then DHCP requests from VM are dropped by OVS flow
and VM can not acquire a DHCP IP.
This patch adds a rule to allow DHCP requests passing through OVN ACL.

Change-Id: I6213009cd4e8c01cfaf6de7e57e5644662bc34c4
Closes-Bug: #1670663
Signed-off-by: Dong Jun <dongj@dtdream.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/67/443067/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Allow DHCP requests and responses through from IPs on the local subnet. # We do this even if DHCP isn't enabled for the subnet. # Add DHCP ACLs regardless of whether using OVN native DHCP or not. port_subnet_ids = set() for ip in port['fixed_ips']: if netaddr.IPNetwork(ip['ip_address']).version != 4: continue subnet = _get_subnet_from_cache(plugin, admin_context, subnet_cache, ip['subnet_id']) # Ignore duplicate DHCP ACLs for the subnet. if subnet['id'] not in port_subnet_ids: acl_list += add_acl_dhcp(port, subnet) port_subnet_ids.add(subnet['id'])
deleted_lines: from networking_ovn.common import config # Allow DHCP responses through from source IPs on the local subnet. # We do this even if DHCP isn't enabled for the subnet. It could be # enabled later. We could hook into handling when it's enabled/disabled # for a subnet, but this only used when OVN native DHCP is disabled. # Add DHCP ACLs if not using OVN native DHCP. if not config.is_ovn_dhcp(): port_subnet_ids = set() for ip in port['fixed_ips']: if netaddr.IPNetwork(ip['ip_address']).version != 4: continue subnet = _get_subnet_from_cache(plugin, admin_context, subnet_cache, ip['subnet_id']) # Ignore duplicate DHCP ACLs for the subnet. if subnet['id'] not in port_subnet_ids: acl_list += add_acl_dhcp(port, subnet) port_subnet_ids.add(subnet['id'])

commit_message:
Do not use backports repo if it is deliberately not enabled

In https://review.openstack.org/442592 the option to not use
the backports repo for Ubuntu Trusty was added to allow a
deployer to use their own consolidated apt mirror.

This configuration fails due to the default_release argument
in the apt package installation.

This patch ensures that the default_release argument is omitted
if the backports repo addition is deliberately disabled.

Change-Id: If3ec51a4d518bf159f3f13ad5865fb665118b2d1

commit_message:
HAProxy: Refactor certificate retrieval bits

This moves the certificate request bits to simplify the profile and move
the logic to the HAProxy/certmonger specific manifest.

This is a small iteration on the effort to separate the certificate
retrieval to its own manifest since this part won't be containerized
yet.

Change-Id: Ibb01cd9a59049e4728615cb4f37e5bfac5800a92
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/50/444850/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Force clean yum metadata when repo config changes

When changing the repo URL, the metadata does not reliably
update, resulting in the right URL being used, but the
wrong package list. This is why we force the metadata to be
cleaned out whenever the repo config changes.

Change-Id: I9bca9a89b58cd539dd5c224d6b141dc4d844bcc2
(cherry picked from commit 1da7340a99328d4d7d89bbcdb9986b4e6c975a67)

commit_message:
Make port bind on dual-stack port

For the container boot from dual-stack network, request_address
will create two ports(with v4 and v6 address), we should only
allow one for port bind.

This patch delete the previous created ports, and then
create a new port with same v4 and v6 ip address.

Change-Id: I99ebc22f1c65b91e82a15247aee9b8d7e623a4a3
Partially-Implements: blueprint ipv6-subnet
Closes-Bug: #1670590

commit_message:
Retry multipath flush when map is in use

When flushing a multipath we are ignoring map in use transient error, so
we log a warning that the flush has not been successful and that we have
received an exit code 1 and we continue to remove the individual paths.

This error is usually transient and a simple retry will succeed in
flushing the multipath.

Failure to retry will leave an empty multipath in our system.

Closes-Bug: #1663936
Change-Id: I710792bd707ad933ef60d11d25f530dddfb6fb2f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-brick refs/changes/03/433103/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @utils.retry(exceptions=putils.ProcessExecutionError) if exc.exit_code == 1 and 'map in use' in exc.stdout: LOG.debug('Multipath is in use, cannot be flushed yet.') raise

commit_message:
Replace unconditional wait for compute kit

Currently After the compute kit charts are deployed, the gate task
unconditionally wait for 10 minutes before running basic tests. This
patch replaces unconditional wait timer for a function which verifies
services individually and if the services are up, exit with 0.

Change-Id: Id1bc147b824fc73d3652db909846adeb9c89cce2
Closes-Bug: #1664322
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes refs/changes/13/444613/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Fix multipath flush when using friendly names
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-13 15:03:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/os-brick/commit/b47c5d535ae37eb15983bddb7b33da3e95b23ceb', 'message': "Fix multipath flush when using friendly names

When we are using friendly names for multipath the multipaths are not
getting flushed, which may lead to data loss on slow connections and
multipath entries with no actual paths.

This happens in both iSCSI and FC connections, and it is due to the
flush being requested on the WWN instead of the actual name of the
device.

So when we are not using friendly names the WWN and the device name are
the same and our call to multipath -f will successfully flush remaining
data, but when we are using friendly names they will not match, and the
call to multipath -f will silently fail (return code 0) and the flush
will not actually go through. When the flush doesn't happen, if there is
remaining data, then the multipath will stay once the individual paths
have been removed.

Closes-Bug: #1663925

commit_message:
Fix multipath flush when using friendly names

When we are using friendly names for multipath the multipaths are not
getting flushed, which may lead to data loss on slow connections and
multipath entries with no actual paths.

This happens in both iSCSI and FC connections, and it is due to the
flush being requested on the WWN instead of the actual name of the
device.

So when we are not using friendly names the WWN and the device name are
the same and our call to multipath -f will successfully flush remaining
data, but when we are using friendly names they will not match, and the
call to multipath -f will silently fail (return code 0) and the flush
will not actually go through. When the flush doesn't happen, if there is
remaining data, then the multipath will stay once the individual paths
have been removed.

Closes-Bug: #1663925
Change-Id: Ib93d945a5b5fca57bcac4e176d62d1412b95f2da

commit_message:
Mark 'undercloud deploy' as experimental

This patch marks the 'undercloud deploy' feature as experimental
for Pike. There is not yet agreement on when this will (if ever)
replace instack-undercloud. Until then I think marking it as
experimental is wise to avoid confusion should we release Pike
without converting 'undercloud install' to make use of this.

Change-Id: Id6f1343994429db2feb8250332dd9e1c62b73fde

commit_message:
Add puppet to "adding a new language" docs

Non-developers will overwhelmingly install the UI via the "openstack
undercloud" command, which means using puppet-tripleo to manage the UI
configuration file. If we want new languages to be picked up and
available for a normal install, the UI puppet manifest also needs to be
updated as part of enabling a new language.

Change-Id: I46fa539f70552e37109086f377854b9e4da7730c

Additionally, the puppet-tripleo module also needs to be updated for users installing the UI via the ``openstack undercloud install`` command. 4. The puppet UI manifest ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ When deploying the UI as part of a normal undercloud install, the configuration file is created and managed by the `puppet-tripleo`_ module. The `manifest for the UI`_ must be modified in two places: .. code-block:: puppet # ./manifests/ui.pp # [*enabled_languages*] # Which languages to show in the UI. # An array. # Defaults to ['en', 'ja'] [...] $enabled_languages = ['en', 'ja'], .. _puppet-tripleo: http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/puppet-tripleo .. _manifest for the UI: http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/puppet-tripleo/tree/manifests/ui.pp

commit_message:
WIP Fixes Category Package Count not showing in Dashboard+GLARE.

The Browse > Browse Local screen's App Category drop-down does
not currently show package count with GLARE enabled. This is
also the case in Manage > Categories page.

This change shows package count with GLARE on both these screens,
and updates functional tests to work with changes.

Change-Id: I24f6e19587aa0ea1d96e0bda9e003c14fc44b4be
Partial-Bug: #1656928
Depends-On: I7ee936a46d9ae2b4b5b8c8305f2807a562bf4d39

commit_message:
Add "list Glance API versions" test

Many projects provides multiple API versions and the version
information is very important for users, because users can know
what features are available on clouds. However, Tempest didn't
test the Clance API versions in long-term. So this patch adds
the corresponding test.

Change-Id: Ib85819fb71f0b12b64351b307d83a3beb77d7fad

commit_message:
Fix HNAS snapshot management section

This commit introduces a minor fix in the HNAS config reference wrt
snapshot management. The previous phrasing was a little imprecise as to
the necessary folder structure for existing and newly created snapshots.

Change-Id: Ic7fce241e8ade20c9fe97da69b0ae4643c83c0d2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/43/445443/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: snapshots. Existing HNAS snapshots can be managed, as long as the snapshot directory is located in ``/snapshots/share_ID``. New snapshots created through the Shared File Systems service are also created according to this specific folder structure.
deleted_lines: snapshots. All new share snapshots are created inside a directory ``/snapshots/share_ID``. Existing HNAS snapshots can also be managed, as long as they respect the pre-existing folder structure.

commit_message:
RBD driver doesn't flatten image when clone depth > configured value.

RBD driver has a rbd_max_clone_depth config option which would trigger
image flatten operation when a RBD image has been chain-cloned to that
value.  But the driver only trigger flatten when actual clone depth
equals rbd_max_clone_depth.  There are cases where actual clone depth
is bigger than rbd_max_clone_depth (for example: admin somehow changed
rbd_max_clone_depth from a bigger value to a smaller value),
auto-flatten won't be triggered.  This change allows RBD driver to
flatten image has been cloned >= rbd_max_clone_depth.

Closes-Bug: #1644129

Change-Id: Ic6e62ffcb4aded6ee9a652a1f4d0a1db5eac0ceb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/14/401914/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if depth >= self.configuration.rbd_max_clone_depth: # Delete parent clone snap, when parent # do not have children. parent_volume.set_snap(snap) list_children = parent_volume.list_children() if not list_children: try: parent_volume.unprotect_snap(snap) parent_volume.remove_snap(snap) finally: parent_volume.close()
deleted_lines: # If clone depth was reached, flatten should have occurred so if it has # been exceeded then something has gone wrong. if depth > self.configuration.rbd_max_clone_depth: raise Exception(_("clone depth exceeds limit of %s") % (self.configuration.rbd_max_clone_depth)) if depth == self.configuration.rbd_max_clone_depth: # Delete parent clone snap try: parent_volume.unprotect_snap(snap) parent_volume.remove_snap(snap) finally: parent_volume.close()

commit_message:
NG details view route should not be '/project/...'

Right now the route includes the name 'project'
but we may have details view for 'identity' and
'admin' too, so it should be more general.

Picked just 'ngdetails' instead and moved this out as a
constant. Since this constant needs to be used
by the config blocks, I moved it out into its own
constant module.

Change-Id: I7603250dd70eb40568aa74be2ae4821ee8fcefcc
Closes-Bug: #1641250
(cherry picked from commit c73e1c8fa82c8059d0c8e8848413380ab6050ad5)

subject: Fix iSCSI multipath rescan
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-13 15:03:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/os-brick/commit/a4c2084fcbf8ff7e21b14801c485ba22a276e917', 'message': "Fix iSCSI multipath rescan

iSCSI multipath rescan uses iscsiadm --rescan option for nodes and
sessions, which can end up recreating devices that had just been removed
if there's a race condition between the removal of a SCSI device and the
connection of a volume.

The race condition happens if a rescan done when attaching happens right
between us removing the path and removing the exported lun, because the
rescan will add not only the new path we are attaching, but the old path
we are removing, since the lun still hasn't been removed.

This would leave orphaned devices that unnecessarily pollute our
environment,

This patch narrows the rescan to only rescan for the specific target id,
channel, and lun number if we can find this information.

When we cannot find this information we do the scan as we were doing it
before.

Closes-Bug: #1664032
Change-Id: I1b3bd34db260165a6ea9ca061f946d6dfcf8553f

commit_message:
Fix iSCSI multipath rescan

iSCSI multipath rescan uses iscsiadm --rescan option for nodes and
sessions, which can end up recreating devices that had just been removed
if there's a race condition between the removal of a SCSI device and the
connection of a volume.

The race condition happens if a rescan done when attaching happens right
between us removing the path and removing the exported lun, because the
rescan will add not only the new path we are attaching, but the old path
we are removing, since the lun still hasn't been removed.

This would leave orphaned devices that unnecessarily pollute our
environment,

This patch narrows the rescan to only rescan for the specific target id,
channel, and lun number if we can find this information.

When we cannot find this information we do the scan as we were doing it
before.

Closes-Bug: #1664032
Change-Id: I1b3bd34db260165a6ea9ca061f946d6dfcf8553f

commit_message:
Update the trove classifiers

Some of our tools no longer work as expected under python2.  We've set
our basepython to python3 in tox.  So lets call that out in our metadata.

Change-Id: I62043a85cd5216ca45293f67476743f07c39d588

commit_message:
Astute do not respect debug option for puppet task

Run cluster with enable debug option do not affect
puppet task which always run with debug disable.

It is happened because Nailgun send debug option which
Astute setup for every task, but puppet task required
puppet_debug option to control it behavior. This code
will connect this parameters.

Change-Id: I8df68105aa699e83673c39a0f03bb22673171d6f
Closes-Bug: #1662512
(cherry picked from commit 003a0a0efdbedf51fef943586286e00068175b43)

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. require File.join(File.dirname(__FILE__), '../../spec_helper') describe Astute::Shell do include SpecHelpers let(:task) do { 'parameters' => { 'debug' => false, 'retries' => 1, 'puppet_manifest' => 'puppet_manifest_example.pp', 'puppet_modules' => '/etc/puppet/modules', 'cwd' => '/', 'timeout' => nil, 'succeed_retries' => 1, 'timeout' => 180 }, 'type' => 'puppet', 'id' => 'puppet_task_example', 'node_id' => 'node_id', } end let(:ctx) { mock_ctx } subject { Astute::Puppet.new(task, ctx) } describe '#run' do before { Astute::Puppet.any_instance.stubs(:process) } context 'debug behavior' do it 'puppet debug should disable if debug option disable or missing' do subject.run expect(subject.task['parameters']['puppet_debug']).to eq(false) end it 'puppet debug should enable if debug enable' do task['parameters']['debug'] = true subject.run expect(subject.task['parameters']['debug']).to eq(true) expect(subject.task['parameters']['puppet_debug']).to eq(true) end end # context end # 'run' end

subject: Workaround for unmatching scheme in discovery
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-14 16:12:07.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/discover.py', 'keystoneclient/_discover.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-keystoneclient/commit/2d02b3a1e789868e92ed7d849297a58e4c88980f', 'message': "Workaround for unmatching scheme in discovery

when doing keystone discovery, there are issues returning the scheme in
specific scenarios: e.g. when keystone is deployed behind a TLS proxy,
and oslo.middleware's http_proxy_to_wsgi is not available.

To workaround this, we could remember the original scheme that was given
as the auth_url, and try to use that in case the URL gotten via
discovery is not working.

Even though this scenario is a common misconfiguration of the
loadbalancer and keystone. This is unfortunately a very common issue.
So working around this in keystoneclient seems like the best way to go,
as it will ease the transition for moving services to use discovery and
not rely on versioned endpoints.

The original patch where this was discussed is this one:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/443104/

Change-Id: I1ee828215d0a0184474021d6236c2bc234af5176
"}]
commit_message:
Workaround for unmatching scheme in discovery

when doing keystone discovery, there are issues returning the scheme in
specific scenarios: e.g. when keystone is deployed behind a TLS proxy,
and oslo.middleware's http_proxy_to_wsgi is not available.

To workaround this, we could remember the original scheme that was given
as the auth_url, and try to use that in case the URL gotten via
discovery is not working.

Even though this scenario is a common misconfiguration of the
loadbalancer and keystone. This is unfortunately a very common issue.
So working around this in keystoneclient seems like the best way to go,
as it will ease the transition for moving services to use discovery and
not rely on versioned endpoints.

The original patch where this was discussed is this one:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/443104/

Change-Id: I1ee828215d0a0184474021d6236c2bc234af5176
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-keystoneclient refs/changes/59/445559/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from six.moves.urllib import parse as urlparse self._session = session self._authenticated = authenticated self._original_scheme = urlparse.urlparse(url).scheme def _get_version_data_url(self, version_data): try: get_version_data(self._session, version_data['url'], authenticated=self._authenticated) # incoming URL worked, so use it. return version_data['url'] except Exception: version_dara_url = urlparse.urlparse(version_data['url']) version_dara_url_scheme = version_dara_url.scheme if version_dara_url_scheme != self._original_scheme: try: new_url = version_dara_url._replace( scheme=self._original_scheme).geturl() get_version_data(self._session, new_url, authenticated=self._authenticated) # If the URL with the original scheme worked, return it return new_url except Exception: pass # Return original URL as it has always done return version_data['url']

commit_message:
Allow newer SQLAlchemy

This removes the < 1.1 cap for global requirements so
that the version bump may be proposed to downstream
projects.   The upper-constraints stays at 1.0.17 until
downstream requirements.txts can all be updated.

Change-Id: I32f37045d8ac4156091ea3e7e9b6e0b3e9463cd7

commit_message:
Set port to ACTIVE in post processing

Since the call could take a while until it reaches ODL it makes more
sense to put the port to active after the request has been sent rather
than when the request to bind the port is received.

This is a temporary solution until a more robust one that relies on
retreiving the port status from the ODL controller is available.

Change-Id: I0e9d48e7e4cbe6ada720aae769a23e769e737e57
