commit_message:
objects: add new field cpuset_reserved in NUMACell

NUMA nodes should store the pCPUs reserved for the hypervisor
to allow drivers to use them and allow to compute NUMA topology
resources usage.

implements blueprint libvirt-emulator-threads-policy

Change-Id: Ieec2e698d6ca8ce4257e0db2f21e3021b3d7d479
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/74/400874/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Version 1.4: Add cpus_overhead field VERSION = '1.4' if target_version < (1, 4): primitive.pop('cpus_overhead', None) 'cpus_overhead': obj_fields.SetOfIntegersField(nullable=True), if 'cpus_overhead' not in kwargs: self.cpus_overhead = None self.obj_reset_changes(['cpus_overhead'])

subject: libvirt: Remove redundant bdm serial mangling and saving during swap_volume
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-09 13:44:20.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/a714ffe89f1201c2b238284be3a4817b497b161b', 'message': "libvirt: Remove redundant bdm serial mangling and saving during swap_volume

During an initial swap_volume call the serial of the original volume was
previously stashed in the connection_info of the new volume by the
compute layer. This was used by I19d5182d11 to allow the virt driver to
lookup and update the existing BDM with the new volume's connection_info
after it had been used by connect_volume.

Future calls to swap_volume in the compute layer would not
update the serial found in the old volume connection_info. This would
result in an invalid serial being copied into the new volume
connection_info and used to preform a lookup of a BDM that didn't exist.

To correct this we now explicitly set the serial of the new volume to
that of the new volume id. While the correct serial id should already be
present in the connection_info provided by most backend Cinder volume
drivers the act of updating this dict is required by our own functional
tests to invoke a failure case :

https://git.io/vDmRE

The serial is updated once more to match the volume id returned
by os-migrate-volume-completion prior to the BDM being updated in the
compute layer.

The BDM lookup and save from the virt layer is also removed as the
compute layer retains a reference to new_cinfo and will update the BDM
with this, including any modifications, at the end of swap_volume.

Finally, the associated Tempest admin test is also extended by the
following change to now attempt a second volume swap to verify these
changes :

I2a2c80a164b9f75d0e7e0503a24194bedfc0e66b

Conflicts:
        nova/compute/manager.py

NOTE(lyarwood): Simple conflict caused by I90d4ffcb adding an error
notification for swap_volume.

Closes-bug: #1661016
Change-Id: If74dd9d8e7191047b6f1cd7e35b6fc667f004f91
(cherry picked from commit 1bf7ac804808eb0d4a68847e466f5fa7d1dcd55e)
(cherry picked from commit 4bf211c617814d46d590bb7b11806170f5c19484)
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Remove redundant bdm serial mangling and saving during swap_volume

During an initial swap_volume call the serial of the original volume was
previously stashed in the connection_info of the new volume by the
compute layer. This was used by I19d5182d11 to allow the virt driver to
lookup and update the existing BDM with the new volume's connection_info
after it had been used by connect_volume.

Future calls to swap_volume in the compute layer would not
update the serial found in the old volume connection_info. This would
result in an invalid serial being copied into the new volume
connection_info and used to preform a lookup of a BDM that didn't exist.

To correct this we now explicitly set the serial of the new volume to
that of the new volume id. While the correct serial id should already be
present in the connection_info provided by most backend Cinder volume
drivers the act of updating this dict is required by our own functional
tests to invoke a failure case :

https://git.io/vDmRE

The serial is updated once more to match the volume id returned
by os-migrate-volume-completion prior to the BDM being updated in the
compute layer.

The BDM lookup and save from the virt layer is also removed as the
compute layer retains a reference to new_cinfo and will update the BDM
with this, including any modifications, at the end of swap_volume.

Finally, the associated Tempest admin test is also extended by the
following change to now attempt a second volume swap to verify these
changes :

I2a2c80a164b9f75d0e7e0503a24194bedfc0e66b

Conflicts:
        nova/compute/manager.py

NOTE(lyarwood): Simple conflict caused by I90d4ffcb adding an error
notification for swap_volume.

Closes-bug: #1661016
Change-Id: If74dd9d8e7191047b6f1cd7e35b6fc667f004f91
(cherry picked from commit 1bf7ac804808eb0d4a68847e466f5fa7d1dcd55e)
(cherry picked from commit 4bf211c617814d46d590bb7b11806170f5c19484)

commit_message:
Add bindep support

Bindep is an automation tool used by openstack-infra to bootstrap a
worker with default packages. This is not needed, since we depend on
puppet to automate this step.

Change-Id: I7d27d72f249c211a25ca3ab208d6d4babe87f4dc

commit_message:
Seperate each policy rule with new line

Changed generator code to add new line at the end of each policy,
so that it would be easier to read. This change is required for
implementing this spec https://review.openstack.org/#/c/433010/

blueprint policy-docs
Change-Id: Ie85516b2741c94bab6e9bcd65f92ce38cb250fc6

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-08 16:53:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/requirements/commit/6be4d42b139dcacfa82ac7ae76b1b36d6fd75377', 'message': "Add betamax-matchers to global-requirements

- Is the library actively maintained?

  Yes, I maintain it. I use it for my own projects and there are others
  who also use and help maintain it (outside the OpenStack bubble).

- Is the library good code?

  We test thoroughly and use continuous integration services to ensure
  backwards compatibility.

- Is the library python 3 compatible?

  Yes

- Is the library license compatible?

  Yes - It is released under Apache 2.0

- Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu
  latest / Fedora latest)?

  Ubuntu: No
  Fedora: No
  SUSE:   No
  Gentoo: No, but the search doesn't indicate they package
          python-betamax either which the other three package.

- Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries
  in ``global-requirements.txt``?

  No. This provides additional matchers for betamax and nothing else
  does that.

- Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or
  infrastructure setup? (Answer to this should be Yes, of course)
  Which?

  openstack/python-cratonclient needs this library for testing. The
  change that depends on this is:
  Ib69d825a50a7e4179aefd11bcbfbed39c27c7fbe

commit_message:
Add betamax-matchers to global-requirements

- Is the library actively maintained?

  Yes, I maintain it. I use it for my own projects and there are others
  who also use and help maintain it (outside the OpenStack bubble).

- Is the library good code?

  We test thoroughly and use continuous integration services to ensure
  backwards compatibility.

- Is the library python 3 compatible?

  Yes

- Is the library license compatible?

  Yes - It is released under Apache 2.0

- Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu
  latest / Fedora latest)?

  Ubuntu: No
  Fedora: No
  SUSE:   No
  Gentoo: No, but the search doesn't indicate they package
          python-betamax either which the other three package.

- Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries
  in ``global-requirements.txt``?

  No. This provides additional matchers for betamax and nothing else
  does that.

- Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or
  infrastructure setup? (Answer to this should be Yes, of course)
  Which?

  openstack/python-cratonclient needs this library for testing. The
  change that depends on this is:
  Ib69d825a50a7e4179aefd11bcbfbed39c27c7fbe

Change-Id: I45de545b040d2b99ac8f3f4d3c81359615d328e8

commit_message:
Use public and unified method get_console_url()

Novaclient has provided a public and unified method
get_console_url() to get console urls of server.
This change switches to use it.

Change-Id: I506fb3752872f3769f53ce4a004889481edfa1b7
Closes-Bug: #1654508

commit_message:
Refactor journal main loop

Some refactoring of the journal's main loop:
* Improve logging - Clearer messages, less log flood
* Terminology - Use 'entry' not 'row' since we're logically dealing with
  entries
* Removed some unhelpful comments
* General code improvements for easier code

Change-Id: I3049ba91bf1908a1104fdbdf3b81bcf8ac3dfffe

commit_message:
Eager load event's resource prop. data when appropiate

Eager load an event's resource properties data in the list_events
"show event" case, i.e. when an event uuid is specified. When showing
multiple events, the events' resource properties data should not be
eager loaded.

Change-Id: I12e371dcbdae398360e28200e68f4a75831f8f17
Closes-bug: #1665506

commit_message:
Test for kube config

The current script blindly overwrites a user's config. It's simple
to test for it. Persumably, a user with a valid ~/.kube/config
would not need to have this overwritten.

Change-Id: I3bb9176b42fabe8139fb1a5ad8745deea649f353
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes refs/changes/37/444037/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [ ! -e ~/.kube/config ]; then mkdir -p ~/.kube sudo cat /etc/kubernetes/kubelet.conf > ~/.kube/config fi

commit_message:
Remove baremetal notification from nova notifier

This is a revert of change I3d53bff8278dabafd929ecbea0b4b3b441c9e1cf

The nova notifier was updated to notify nova on ports with the
baremetal: device_owner, these ports are owned by Ironic not Nova, so
nova is getting notifications that it doesn't understand.

Change-Id: I8318a682163f6a5b739be68ce56973c43d0e32f2
Closes-Bug: #1656010
Depends-On: I43c3af9f424a65211ef5a39f13e4810072997339

commit_message:
iptables: stop 'fixing' kernel sysctl bridge firewalling knobs

Those are different on different kernel versions, and have reasonable
default values on all newer kernel versions, including RHEL. We
nevertheless made devstack to set those in the past; now I propose to
clean the code from neutron tree and leave it up to deployment tools to
fix in an unlikely case the system has broken default values.

Now that iptables firewall code does not trigger sysctl, we can also
remove this filter from the corresponding rootwrap .filters file.

DocImpact make sure deployment docs mention the expected sysctl knob
          values.

Change-Id: Iabf61021c90b0536be274463d48fb5a572ecc023
Related-Bug: #1622914

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-09 15:55:18.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/cmd/sanity/checks.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/01cb8b1c440d0bb8577eb1c03fd10513bd0ccfe4', 'message': 'Disable process monitor for keepalived test

There was an existing attempt to disable process monitoring, but
since the AGENT.check_child_processes_interval defaults to 60 and
is checked in ProcessMonitor.__init__, overriding the config value
after instantiating the ProcessMonitor only has the affect of
making the check happen continually as quickly as possible instead
of not at all. Instead, we instantiate the process monitor after

Change-Id: Ic4907b6a227c6fa8288c9d3e2106da0b53323509

commit_message:
Disable process monitor for keepalived test

There was an existing attempt to disable process monitoring, but
since the AGENT.check_child_processes_interval defaults to 60 and
is checked in ProcessMonitor.__init__, overriding the config value
after instantiating the ProcessMonitor only has the affect of
making the check happen continually as quickly as possible instead
of not at all. Instead, we instantiate the process monitor after
changing the config value.

Change-Id: Ic4907b6a227c6fa8288c9d3e2106da0b53323509
Closes-Bug: #1665061
(cherry picked from commit 0faf1aa49f18e8dcbee6ea8be78f6e918090e0a1)

We both enables router_distributed and l3_ha in server side,

Change-Id: I2fab45cff786c475d69c5f0cf4e9b71e6bbbe653

commit_message:
Remove floatingip address ignores ha_state

We both enables router_distributed and l3_ha in server side,
and configures L3 agent node as dvr_snat in compute nodes.
HA router removing floatingip address only in master node,
and dvr local router only remove FIP rule. This will cause
RTNETLINK error if we operates floatingip "associate --> disassociate
--> reassociate".

This patch removes floatingip address whether router's ha_state
is master or backup.
Another solution is adding remove_floating_ip in dvr_edge_router.

Conflicts:
	neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_ha_router.py

Change-Id: I2fab45cff786c475d69c5f0cf4e9b71e6bbbe653
Closes-Bug: #1641535
(cherry picked from commit b45fd35e3f4a2aaacc7a22faafd00b7350e4f398)

commit_message:

commit_message:
Remove invalid tests-py3 whitelist item

The tests for XenAPI plugins were introduced with change [1].
This change also appended them to the python3 test whitelist,
as the functionality could only be executed on python2.4 environment.
The aforementioned changes were removed with change [2], but
the whitelist item was left behind. This change removes the obsolete
line.

[1] 2aa81e9ef6d04f2fdf1c69e16ceeef156cefedfa
[2] 21149582ff944585fb0a815ebe9515c1ec38eb7f

Change-Id: Ibc15e9a06adf34512eda904d0bb3eba1eed04784
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/60/438660/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix pod_id length inconsistency in data model

1. What is the problem
Pod_id is a foreign key in cached_endpoints table and resource_routings
table, it references pod_id in pod table but has different length. For
more detailed information, please see the bug at the bottom.

2. What is the solution for the problem
Change pod_id length in cached_endpoints table and resource_routings
table. For these two tables in migration scripts we use script to
alter the pod_id length.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle to
realize the solution
None.

Change-Id: I5ccfc2b72bcac2793c0901fd90c78edce181c074
Closes-Bug: #1670228
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tricircle refs/changes/32/441732/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: pod_id = sql.Column('pod_id', sql.String(length=36), pod_id = sql.Column('pod_id', sql.String(length=36),
deleted_lines: pod_id = sql.Column('pod_id', sql.String(length=64), pod_id = sql.Column('pod_id', sql.String(length=64),

commit_message:
Install packages with roles in multinode

Use extras roles to build packages and install them both on
primary node and subnodes.

Change-Id: I3ff6bffe36aab3faa078f17d1da99b94da7154c5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/87/443687/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Run DLRN gate role and install repo hosts: undercloud vars: artg_compressed_gating_repo: "${HOME}/gating_repo.tar.gz" artg_repos_dir: "{{ tripleo_root}}" roles: - build-test-packages - { role: install-built-repo, when: compressed_gating_repo is defined } tags: - build - name: Install built packages on subnodes hosts: overcloud vars: ib_repo_host: undercloud roles: - { role: install-built-repo, when: compressed_gating_repo is defined } tags: - build

subject: WIP: Make it easier to avoid live-migration timeouts
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-07 10:30:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/8c1d5c4a04f7828934ef245048945ea1fc9d6917', 'message': 'Mark live_migration_downtime_steps as deprecated for removal

Live migration downtime steps is a flag that only makes configuration
of live migration more complicated. Removing this flag does not take
anything away from the operators. Operators will still have possibility
to reach target maximum downtime faster (if needed) just by changing
live_migration_downtime_delay flag to small values.

Live migration downtime steps is a flag that only makes configuration

Change-Id: I88b115ccfa00c2b4465302ad25799b37c3124c29
'}, {'number': 7, 'created': '2017-01-25 16:59:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/1f38a495066a1e9d5a840531505361d7044c9b77', 'message': 'Mark live_migration_downtime_steps/delay as deprecated for removal

Live migration downtime steps and delay are flags that makes
configuration of live migration complicated. Operators need
to configure to care about two correlated values to increase
chances of successful live migration.

To make live migration configuration simpler, this patch
introduces new configuration option:

live_migration_time_to_max_downtime

and deprecates live_migration_downtime_steps/delay configuration
options. New config option is to set time, in seconds, required
to reach the maximum permitted downtime for live migration switchover.

Change-Id: I88b115ccfa00c2b4465302ad25799b37c3124c29
'}, {'number': 8, 'created': '2017-01-27 07:06:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/0c487d796b4f563958620a78efd458b2b17e436d', 'message': 'Mark live_migration_downtime_steps/delay as deprecated for removal

Live migration downtime steps and delay are flags that makes
configuration of live migration complicated. Operators need
to configure to care about two correlated values to increase
chances of successful live migration.

To make live migration configuration simpler, this patch
introduces new configuration option:

live_migration_time_to_max_downtime

and deprecates live_migration_downtime_steps/delay configuration
options. New config option is to set time, in seconds, required
to reach the maximum permitted downtime for live migration switchover.

Change-Id: I88b115ccfa00c2b4465302ad25799b37c3124c29
'}, {'number': 9, 'created': '2017-02-10 12:05:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/c9dc09926a86301c4d4de23a26e9e77d20eabd46', 'message': 'Make it easier to avoid live-migration timeouts

If you are having live-migrations timeout, and you want to avoid that
happening, the key configuration options to consider now are:

* live_migration_downtime
* live_migration_completion_timeout

Where live_migration_downtime tunes how much guest downtime you are
willing to tolerate during the live-migration and
live_migration_completion_timeout defines how long you are willing to
wait for a 1GB ram (with no storage to move) to have a small enough
amount of memory to copy that it can happen in under
live_migration_downtime seconds.

After this change, by default, we spend half of the completion_timeout
time ramping up to the max downtime defined in live_migration_downtime.
This means we try and avoid guest downtime, but take a little longer.

If you want to avoid this ramp up, and start with
live_migration_downtime as the max downtime straight away, then set
live_migration_time_to_max_downtime = 0

You can use live_migration_time_to_max_downtime to decide how fast or
slow to ramp up the max guest downtime, but usually you should be able
to get what you want without having to consider that configuration
setting.

live_migration_time_to_max_downtime is replacing
live_migration_downtime_steps and live_migration_downtime_delay.
The single configuration more closely matches how deployers should be
thinking about this problem.

Change-Id: I88b115ccfa00c2b4465302ad25799b37c3124c29
'}, {'number': 10, 'created': '2017-02-10 12:10:33.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/migration.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_migration.py', 'nova/conf/libvirt.py', 'releasenotes/notes/deprecate-live-migration-downtime-steps-0d4254d529398666.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/f606d056c73c85fecaf75430dd5c104f0fe84a27', 'message': 'WIP: Make it easier to avoid live-migration timeouts

If you are having live-migrations timeout, and you want to avoid that
happening, the key configuration options to consider now are:

* live_migration_downtime
* live_migration_completion_timeout

Where live_migration_downtime tunes how much guest downtime you are
willing to tolerate during the live-migration and
live_migration_completion_timeout defines how long you are willing to
wait for a 1GB ram (with no storage to move) to have a small enough
amount of memory to copy that it can happen in under
live_migration_downtime seconds.

After this change, by default, we spend half of the completion_timeout
time ramping up to the max downtime defined in live_migration_downtime.
This means we try and avoid guest downtime, but take a little longer.

If you want to avoid this ramp up, and start with
live_migration_downtime as the max downtime straight away, then set
live_migration_time_to_max_downtime = 0

You can use live_migration_time_to_max_downtime to decide how fast or
slow to ramp up the max guest downtime, but usually you should be able
to get what you want without having to consider that configuration
setting.

live_migration_time_to_max_downtime is replacing
live_migration_downtime_steps and live_migration_downtime_delay.
The single configuration more closely matches how deployers should be
thinking about this problem.

Change-Id: I88b115ccfa00c2b4465302ad25799b37c3124c29
'}]
commit_message:
WIP: Make it easier to avoid live-migration timeouts

If you are having live-migrations timeout, and you want to avoid that
happening, the key configuration options to consider now are:

* live_migration_downtime
* live_migration_completion_timeout

Where live_migration_downtime tunes how much guest downtime you are
willing to tolerate during the live-migration and
live_migration_completion_timeout defines how long you are willing to
wait for a 1GB ram (with no storage to move) to have a small enough
amount of memory to copy that it can happen in under
live_migration_downtime seconds.

After this change, by default, we spend half of the completion_timeout
time ramping up to the max downtime defined in live_migration_downtime.
This means we try and avoid guest downtime, but take a little longer.

If you want to avoid this ramp up, and start with
live_migration_downtime as the max downtime straight away, then set
live_migration_time_to_max_downtime = 0

You can use live_migration_time_to_max_downtime to decide how fast or
slow to ramp up the max guest downtime, but usually you should be able
to get what you want without having to consider that configuration
setting.

live_migration_time_to_max_downtime is replacing
live_migration_downtime_steps and live_migration_downtime_delay.
The single configuration more closely matches how deployers should be
thinking about this problem.

Change-Id: I88b115ccfa00c2b4465302ad25799b37c3124c29

commit_message:
Tail correct log files with devstack

We recently changed devstack to use httpd+mod_wsgi as the
default and split the access logs. However, we don't seem
to tail the correct log files.

Change-Id: I3aaefc92e6dbf4721b6a979fc72835abe9b54f14
Closes-Bug: #1661495

commit_message:
Add --stop option for bugs-fixed-since

Filter out all the bugs had been merged in stable branch for
a period of time, that is important for downstream team,
so that we can pick some important bugs to backport.

Change-Id: Ib5edd053ac58713e35a6c5818fe2f8fc2d31ba70
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/release-tools refs/changes/15/445315/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Use ``--stop`` option to list bugs mentioned in stable branch messages stopping from a specified commit. Example:: ./bugs-fixed-since.py -B -r ../neutron --start=8.0.0 --stop=origin/stable/mitaka

commit_message:
Remove old comment referencing fixed bug

There was an old comment left regarding this bug:

https://bugs.launchpad.net/pbr/+bug/1260495

which was fixed over a year ago but left over.

This change removes the comment and related extension
and adds the referenced pbr setting.

Change-Id: Ib334c136835a9b5b43cabe13b9616cce45e578e0

commit_message:
Remove references of V1 driver

As v1 has been deprecated in Pike and v2 driver is to be used by
default, the documented references to v1 need to be removed.

Change-Id: I8d03f0dd3c5423590cc84ff9ce1e27c5edc001a8
Partially-Implements: blueprint documentation
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/networking-odl/+spec/documentation
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-odl refs/changes/66/442266/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: To use v2 driver, add this:: > cat local.conf [[local|localrc]] ODL_V2DRIVER = True

commit_message:
Decouple hook and func registration from CommonDbMixin

Move the model query hook registration and resource extend funcs
registration methods out of the CommonDbMixin class and make them
regular utility functions.

This is a step in refactoring the CommonDbMixin class.

Change-Id: Iec1bb7f7098c83640ae695fd7cf2f4736f414ad2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/53/409553/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron.db import _model_query from neutron.db import _resource_extend @staticmethod # TODO(HenryG): Remove this when available in neutron-lib def register_model_query_hook(model, name, query_hook, filter_hook, result_filters=None): _model_query.register_hook( model, name, query_hook, filter_hook, result_filters=result_filters) @staticmethod # TODO(HenryG): Remove this when available in neutron-lib def register_dict_extend_funcs(resource, funcs): _resource_extend.register_funcs(resource, funcs) # TODO(HenryG): Remove; used only by vmware-nsx. for hook in _model_query.get_hooks(model): query_hook = hook.get('query') filter_hook = hook.get('filter') for hook in _model_query.get_hooks(model): result_filter = hook.get('result_filters', None) for func in _resource_extend.get_funcs(resource_type):
deleted_lines: # Plugins, mixin classes implementing extension will register # hooks into the dict below for "augmenting" the "core way" of # building a query for retrieving objects from a model class. # To this aim, the register_model_query_hook and unregister_query_hook # from this class should be invoked _model_query_hooks = {} # This dictionary will store methods for extending attributes of # api resources. Mixins can use this dict for adding their own methods # TODO(salvatore-orlando): Avoid using class-level variables _dict_extend_functions = {} @classmethod def register_model_query_hook(cls, model, name, query_hook, filter_hook, result_filters=None): """Register a hook to be invoked when a query is executed. Add the hooks to the _model_query_hooks dict. Models are the keys of this dict, whereas the value is another dict mapping hook names to callables performing the hook. Each hook has a "query" component, used to build the query expression and a "filter" component, which is used to build the filter expression. Query hooks take as input the query being built and return a transformed query expression. Filter hooks take as input the filter expression being built and return a transformed filter expression """ cls._model_query_hooks.setdefault(model, {})[name] = { 'query': query_hook, 'filter': filter_hook, 'result_filters': result_filters} @classmethod def register_dict_extend_funcs(cls, resource, funcs): cls._dict_extend_functions.setdefault(resource, []).extend(funcs) for _name, hooks in six.iteritems(self._model_query_hooks.get(model, {})): query_hook = hooks.get('query') filter_hook = hooks.get('filter') for _nam, hooks in six.iteritems(self._model_query_hooks.get(model, {})): result_filter = hooks.get('result_filters', None) for func in self._dict_extend_functions.get( resource_type, []):

commit_message:
Change Spark version to 1.6.3

We have seen several instances where Spark 1.6.1 over time
continues to consume more and more resources.

The change Ibf244cbfc00a90ada66f492b473719c25fa17fd2 was not
enough alone to curb this growth, but the new version of Spark
has shown better behavior.

Related changes will also need to be done in any installer,
such as Ansible.

Change-Id: Ib6b1220cf0186def115846c8cf71684bb2d6e8c7

commit_message:
Indicating the location tests directory in oslo_debug_helper

According to [1], we can passing a "-t" argument to
oslo_debug_helper to indicate the directory where tests
are located. This will solves ImportError exception.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslotest/features.html

Change-Id: I0576a175d6295690c9d6d37b808d3fb813b9ca2f
Closes-Bug: #1666560

commit_message:
Add Delete Container Force action

This patch adds "Delete Container Forcely" action for each containers.
This action is too dangerous for batch action, so implemented as only
item action.

Change-Id: Id839f2ce4beb17d7c4280cecf31b29e63f59197f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zun-ui refs/changes/83/445383/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: deleteContainerForce: deleteContainerForce, function deleteContainerForce(id, suppressError) { var promise = apiService.delete(containersPath + id, [id]); return suppressError ? promise : promise.error(function() { var msg = gettext('Unable to delete forcely the Container with id: %(id)s'); toastService.add('error', interpolate(msg, { id: id }, true)); }); }

commit_message:
Add undercloud user to docker group

This enables developers to interface easier with docker without having
to use sudo all the time.

Change-Id: I343d9579a5f0f5a9c31f341cfcb93b4ddc533a4d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras refs/changes/28/445428/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

testing v1 api, only v2 and v3.

commit_message:
Indicating the location tests directory in oslo_debug_helper

According to [1], we can passing a "-t" argument to
oslo_debug_helper to indicate the directory where tests
are located. This will solves ImportError exception.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslotest/features.html

Change-Id: Ifb02c8fc1e8669e859e439c8bfdf008211af6e71
Closes-Bug: #1666560

commit_message:
Fix oslo_debug_helper not running

Specify test directory so that tox won't complain
`ImportError: Start directory is not importable`.
Also fix a warning when running debug.

Change-Id: I389e50a097e1cdc5d070c193ab512218762fa8d5
Closes-Bug: #1666560

commit_message:
New preseed files for Ubuntu 16.04.2

With Ubuntu 16.04.2, passing "minimal" to "tasksel/first" causes an
error.

The new preseed files use "standard system utilities" instead.

Fixing the existing files instead of creating new ones would fix
existing 16.04 installations that will keep pointing to the old
preseed files, but it might break 14.04 installations with no
way of fixing them.

Therefore, leaving the old preseed files for 14.04 based installations
and creating new ones for 16.04 based is the safer choice.

Note that this means we have to fix the preseed names in the Newton
branch.

Change-Id: I113c2adaecc79c54677c329aff4e5c3e2e0b3987
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/training-labs refs/changes/93/445593/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Based on # https://help.ubuntu.com/12.04/installation-guide/example-preseed.txt # # For details, see: # https://help.ubuntu.com/12.04/installation-guide/i386/appendix-preseed.html #------------------------------------------------------------------------------- # Preseeding only locale sets language, country and locale. d-i debian-installer/locale string en_US # Disable automatic (interactive) keymap detection. d-i console-setup/ask_detect boolean false d-i keyboard-configuration/layoutcode string us d-i netcfg/get_hostname string osbash d-i netcfg/get_domain string unassigned-domain #------------------------------------------------------------------------------- # Proxy #d-i mirror/http/proxy string http://192.168.178.20:3128/ d-i mirror/http/proxy string #------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ### Clock and time zone setup # Controls whether or not the hardware clock is set to UTC. d-i clock-setup/utc boolean true d-i time/zone string Etc/UTC #------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ### Partitioning d-i partman-auto/disk string /dev/sda # The presently available methods are: # - regular: use the usual partition types for your architecture # - lvm: use LVM to partition the disk # - crypto: use LVM within an encrypted partition d-i partman-auto/method string regular # You can choose one of the three predefined partitioning recipes: # - atomic: all files in one partition # - home: separate /home partition # - multi: separate /home, /usr, /var, and /tmp partitions d-i partman-auto/choose_recipe select atomic # This makes partman automatically partition without confirmation, provided # that you told it what to do using one of the methods above. d-i partman/confirm_write_new_label boolean true d-i partman/choose_partition select finish d-i partman/confirm boolean true d-i partman/confirm_nooverwrite boolean true #------------------------------------------------------------------------------- # To create a normal user account. d-i passwd/user-fullname string OpenStack user d-i passwd/username string osbash d-i passwd/user-password password osbash d-i passwd/user-password-again password osbash d-i user-setup/allow-password-weak boolean true d-i user-setup/encrypt-home boolean false #------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ### Package selection # (standard system utilities, OpenSSH server, Basic Ubuntu server) tasksel tasksel/first standard system utilities # Individual additional packages to install d-i pkgsel/include string openssh-server dkms localepurge # http://sfxpt.wordpress.com/2013/06/09/get-the-debianubuntu-ready-and-customized-the-way-you-like-in-10-minutes/ ### Pkg:localepurge # Options explained at: http://anonscm.debian.org/cgit/collab-maint/localepurge.git/tree/debian/localepurge.templates localepurge localepurge/nopurge multiselect en_US # Really remove all locales? localepurge localepurge/none_selected boolean false # Also delete localized man pages? localepurge localepurge/mandelete boolean true # Avoid note that localepurge will not take any action until configured localepurge localepurge/remove_no note # Inform about new locales? localepurge localepurge/dontbothernew boolean false # Display verbose output? localepurge localepurge/verbose boolean false # Display freed disk space? localepurge localepurge/showfreedspace boolean true # Accurate disk space calculation? localepurge localepurge/quickndirtycalc boolean true # Use dpkg --path-exclude? localepurge localepurge/use-dpkg-feature bolean true #------------------------------------------------------------------------------- # Whether to upgrade packages after debootstrap. # Allowed values: none, safe-upgrade, full-upgrade d-i pkgsel/upgrade select none # Policy for applying updates. May be "none" (no automatic updates), # "unattended-upgrades" (install security updates automatically), or # "landscape" (manage system with Landscape). d-i pkgsel/update-policy select none # This is fairly safe to set, it makes grub install automatically to the MBR # if no other operating system is detected on the machine. d-i grub-installer/only_debian boolean true # Avoid warning about install CD not containing full support for language d-i pkgsel/install-language-support boolean false # Avoid reboot confirmation d-i finish-install/reboot_in_progress note d-i cdrom-detect/eject boolean true # Halt after installation #d-i debian-installer/exit/poweroff boolean true #ubiquity ubiquity/poweroff boolean true # - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - # Use the following option to add additional boot parameters for the # installed system (if supported by the bootloader installer). # Note: options passed to the installer will be added automatically. # With Ubuntu 12.04 LTS, modesetting may result in a blank console d-i debian-installer/add-kernel-opts string vga=0x301 nomodeset #------------------------------------------------------------------------------- #### Advanced options ### Running custom commands during the installation # d-i preseeding is inherently not secure. Nothing in the installer checks # for attempts at buffer overflows or other exploits of the values of a # preconfiguration file like this one. Only use preconfiguration files from # trusted locations! # This command is run just before the install finishes, but when there is # still a usable /target directory. You can chroot to /target and use it # directly, or use the apt-install and in-target commands to easily install # packages and run commands in the target system. d-i preseed/late_command string chroot /target/ apt-get -y purge virtualbox-guest-dkms virtualbox-guest-utils >/target/root/01_vbox_purge 2>&1; \ mount /dev/sr1 /target/mnt; \ chroot /target /mnt/VBoxLinuxAdditions.run >/target/root/02_vbox_guestadd 2>&1; \ umount /target/mnt; \ sed -i 's/exit 0/# exit 0/' /target/etc/rc.local; \ echo 'exec > /root/bootstrap.log 2>&1;set -x;SCR=/media/sf_bootstrap/autostart/*activate_autostart.sh;while [ ! -f $SCR ];do sleep 1;done;bash $SCR;rm -v $SCR' >> /target/etc/rc.local;

commit_message:
Sahara needs to run ssh-keygen

In order to generate keypair and access to cluster instances,
sahara-base container must include this binary, even when we
deploy based on source type.

Change-Id: I40747bceba3fede66864b781df1da1034ea22d11
Closes-Bug: #1665293
(cherry picked from commit a614a43bebf51aa63de10dfebfa342dc8d44f491)

commit_message:
Fix openrc on zsh

Our openrc files rely on the BASH_SOURCE variable to find configuration
files. This works with bash but not with zsh. With this patch, the
file can also be sourced and used with zsh (on the host machine).

Change-Id: Ice133a31de7fcf21fd48d425f331e6cfac3fbe0c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/training-labs refs/changes/34/445634/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Use BASH_SOURCE so the file works when sourced from a shell, too; use # $0 to make it work on zsh CONFIG_DIR=$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]:-$0}")
deleted_lines: # Use BASH_SOURCE so the file works when sourced from a shell, too CONFIG_DIR=$(dirname "$BASH_SOURCE")

subject: Fix use of absolute paths with log_snapshot_split
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-14 20:05:21.000000000', 'files': ['labs/osbash/tools/log_snapshot_split.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/training-labs/commit/c998eaa8a3819be74767c8659462f84a1fb2241d', 'message': 'Fix use of absolute paths with log_snapshot_split

If absolute paths are passed to log_snapshot_split.py (that is, if the
"ls -l" lines contain absolute paths), then the result files will be
written to these paths which usually means that the original log files
are overwritten.

The script has always been used with relative paths in training-labs,
but any use outside of the project could lead to unexpected outcomes.
To prevent such surprises, this patch makes sure that absolute paths,
too, have the resulting files put into the resultdir supplied by the
user.

In addition, move the creation of result_path down to make the code
easier to understand.

Change-Id: I1a97e827151beb1fb0ce2b8c3308ad0b5b9b5c8c
'}]
commit_message:
Fix use of absolute paths with log_snapshot_split

If absolute paths are passed to log_snapshot_split.py (that is, if the
"ls -l" lines contain absolute paths), then the result files will be
written to these paths which usually means that the original log files
are overwritten.

The script has always been used with relative paths in training-labs,
but any use outside of the project could lead to unexpected outcomes.
To prevent such surprises, this patch makes sure that absolute paths,
too, have the resulting files put into the resultdir supplied by the
user.

In addition, move the creation of result_path down to make the code
easier to understand.

Change-Id: I1a97e827151beb1fb0ce2b8c3308ad0b5b9b5c8c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/training-labs refs/changes/41/445641/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: new_size, log_path = get_size_and_path(ls_line) # If the path in the "ls -l" files is absolute, make it # relative; os.path.join would ignore the target directory path # otherwise log_rpath = log_path.strip("/") result_path = os.path.join(dest_subdir, log_rpath)
deleted_lines: new_size, log_rpath = get_size_and_path(ls_line) result_path = os.path.join(dest_subdir, log_rpath)

commit_message:
Add "Replace" handling for translation

Add "Replace" rule handling to translation mechanism.

Change-Id: Ic96996cfcd3fbaf9e966670451bcce33f5d94673
Closes-bug: #1620859

'.'.join(rule.get_value_absolute_path(True)) self._replaced_props.append(path) self.resolved_translations[path] = None def is_replaced(self, key): return self.cast_key_to_rule(key) in commit_message:
WIP: Updates Magnum for Mitaka

Previously, Kolla's support of Magnum was not functional. The
Containers may start, but you can not create Magnum bays.

This patch adds support for Magnum Mitaka relase.

Change-Id: Ic07b6c4e1e9cdf67d65f9feadfb20a8752b7fb0f
Related-Bug: 1551992

commit_message:
Add deprecating warning for qos v1 driver

QoS V2 driver was merged recently, both V1 and V2 are in the tree
now, any one can be used at the moment. This patch adds a warning
to let users know that the QoS V1 driver will soon be deprecated.

Change-Id: I90dfcf21b3e2d1db129c35132b0df219167bc387
Co-Authored-By: Rajiv Kumar <rajiv.kumar@nectechnologies.in>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-odl refs/changes/18/413218/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import debtcollector import warningswarnings.simplefilter("always") debtcollector.deprecate("QoS v1 driver will be deprecated to v2", version="ocata")

subject: Make user to group test in test_groups_rbac atomic so it passes.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-13 16:02:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/patrole/commit/bc3fa004e7245aa5c6330521070794ed2483481d', 'message': "Make user to group test in test_groups_rbac atomic so it passes.

Currently, test_add_user_group in test_groups_rbac in v3 identity
tests is not implemented correctly, because the API call it performs
implicitly calls _create_test_user, which can cause permissions
errors.

This patch:
  * Refactors test_add_user_group so that it is atomic and thus
    passes.
  * Adds a setUp to test_groups_rbac, because test_add_user_group
    still failed after this change, because by default the tests
    are sorted alphabetically by their name [0], so because this
    test is executed first, the test user wasn't granted
    admin credentials.
  * Refactors _create_test_user so that you don't explicitly
    have to pass a user name and set password=None to the
    function.

[0] http://docs.python.org/library/unittest.html

Change-Id: I795339db89c3c57cb5d7993fe42d798ba494eb85
Closes-Bug: #1672248
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-03-13 18:03:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/patrole/commit/d07d325323352e2bdbcdb34fdcec3d71c2e8b37e', 'message': "Make user to group test in test_groups_rbac atomic so it passes.

Currently, test_add_user_group in test_groups_rbac in v3 identity
tests is not implemented correctly, because the API call it performs
implicitly calls _create_test_user, which can cause permissions
errors.

This patch:
  * Refactors test_add_user_group so that it is atomic and thus
    passes.
  * Adds a setUp to test_groups_rbac, because test_add_user_group
    still failed after this change, because by default the tests
    are sorted alphabetically by their name [0], so because this
    test is executed first, the test user wasn't granted
    admin credentials.
  * Refactors _create_test_user so that you don't explicitly
    have to pass a user name and set password=None to the
    function.

commit_message:
Make user to group test in test_groups_rbac atomic so it passes.

Currently, test_add_user_group in test_groups_rbac in v3 identity
tests is not implemented correctly, because the API call it performs
implicitly calls _create_test_user, which can cause permissions
errors.

This patch:
  * Refactors test_add_user_group so that it is atomic and thus
    passes.
  * Refactors _create_test_user so that you don't explicitly
    have to pass a user name and set password=None to the
    function.

[0] http://docs.python.org/library/unittest.html

Change-Id: I795339db89c3c57cb5d7993fe42d798ba494eb85
Closes-Bug: #1672248

added_lines: def _create_test_user(self, name=None, password=None, **kwargs): if name is None: name = data_utils.rand_name('user') if password is None: password = data_utils.rand_password() user = self.users_client.create_user(name=name, password=password, **kwargs)['user']
deleted_lines: def _create_test_user(self, **kwargs): if kwargs['password'] is None: user_password = data_utils.rand_password() kwargs['password'] = user_password user = self.users_client.create_user(**kwargs)['user']

commit_message:
Init policy in pecan after hook as well

policy.init() is called in the before hook, but this isn't
invoked on GET calls so if the first call a thread receives
is a GET call, we can end up with an uninitialized policy
enforcer and get a traceback.

This just calls policy.init() in the after hook as well.

Change-Id: I29ebc9a91b98a27e707d5b35ad1a24a26e8c8f44
Closes-Bug: #1671267

commit_message:
Make sure to get all tenants by scanning each available domain.

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/25/442625/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_log import log LOG = log.getLogger(__name__) domains = manager.keystone.domains.list() LOG.debug('Found %s keystone domains', len(domains)) if domains: tenants = [] for domain in domains: domain_tenants = manager.keystone.projects.list(domain) LOG.debug("Found %s tenants in domain %s", len(domain_tenants), domain.name) tenants = tenants + domain_tenants else: tenants = manager.keystone.projects.list() LOG.debug("No domains - found %s tenants in default domain", len(tenants))

commit_message:
[docs] Updated restarting services section

Also fixed OpenStack service restarts commands and
removed deprecated services (nova-cert)

Implements: blueprint create-ops-guide

Change-Id: Ida72fa35e84eae8f62ac9f5bf12be6c2222393ee
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/29/444129/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: OpenStack services are containerized with lxc and will require attachment to the container from the controller node hosting the containerized service. It is also possible to ssh into the container from the deployment node in your environment removing the requirement of attaching to the container. Documentation utilizes the 'service' command which works with both upstart or systemd subsystems to restart the OpenStack services. The following table lists the commands to restart an OpenStack service: # service nova-api-os-compute restart # service nova-consoleauth restart # service nova-scheduler restart # service nova-conductor restart # service nova-api-metadata restart # service nova-novncproxy restart (if using novnc) # service nova-spicehtml5proxy restart (if using spice) # service nova-compute restart # service neutron-linuxbridge-agent restart * - Networking service (compute node) - .. code-block: console # service neutron-linuxbridge-agent restart # service cinder-api restart # service cinder-backup restart # service cinder-scheduler restart # service cinder-volume restart # service swift-account-server restart # service swift-container-server restart # service swift-object-expirer restart # service swift-object-server restart # service swift-proxy-server restart
deleted_lines: OpenStack services will require restart from other nodes in your environment. The following table lists the commands to restart an OpenStack service. # service openstack-nova-api restart # service openstack-nova-cert restart # service openstack-nova-consoleauth restart # service openstack-nova-scheduler restart # service openstack-nova-conductor restart # service openstack-nova-novncproxy restart # service openstack-nova-compute restart # service openstack-nova-compute status # service openstack-cinder-api restart # service openstack-cinder-backup restart # service openstack-cinder-scheduler restart # service openstack-cinder-volume restart # service swift-account restart # service swift-container restart # service swift-object restart # service swift-proxy restart

commit_message:
qos: Pass correctly table_id to openflow driver

There was a switch to using uninstall_flows() in
I90ff1055d367609694eef975c7d084e4cd7a2cf4. But native driver doesn't
understand 'table' parameter and requires 'table_id' instead.

Closes-bug: #1672789

Change-Id: I7ccbd074c88d7f5577afcc2bba1489bae0897da5

commit_message:
nova: move tripleo-multinode to check -nv

TripleO CI has provided useful feedback to different projects in
OpenStack, including openstackclient, osc-lib, Gnocchi so far.

TripleO CI is able to build packages by using ZUUL_REF of Nova patches,
we think it would be helpful for both Nova and TripleO groups to have
the jobs part of check pipeline, as non-voting for now.

Nova group: to get the feedback at how it works outside devstack. The
job would be non-voting for now, please don't ignore it and report
failures on #tripleo or ping EmilienM on #openstack-nova. If nobody
replies shortly or don't give feedback on the failure, you can ignore
it and move forward in your review process. Though we hope it can be
useful to track some bugs.

TripleO group: we hope to reduce the number of issues we're having when
trying to promote packages in RDO when pulling Nova from trunk, because
the feedback loop is shortened. If someone from Nova group asks for a
failing job, we should provide quick feedback on why (if it's something
on Nova side or TripleO CI infra side).

Change-Id: I199aaba120fea94968b499162fc3bf80c066f999

commit_message:
Make query in quota api lockless

As one of query to fetch quota usage by resource and tenant
was done in lock mode earlier. This was done to protect the
dirty bit in the usage which tracks for update. For moving to
OVO carrying lock mode can be avoided by making sure that dirty
attribute of quotausages is still protected.

Change-Id: I0bb9f6fb7be51be590afb527a56e0569e922e98f
Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db

commit_message:
Add release notes for 15.0.1 Ocata bug fix release

There are several high severity, high impact bug fixes going
into the upcoming 15.0.1 Ocata release. This change adds release
notes highlighting the most important fixes along with a known
issue for another regression bug that is not yet fixed in Ocata,
but should be shortly.

Change-Id: I06921fed0b1acdd48a23f24b5c42c19f9fb032e4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/75/445575/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- prelude: > The 15.0.1 Ocata release contains fixes for several high severity, high impact bugs. If you have not yet upgraded to 15.0.0, it is recommended to upgrade directly to 15.0.1. issues: - | There is a known regression in Ocata reported in `bug 1671648`_ where server build failures on a compute node are not retried on another compute node. The fix for this bug is being worked and will be provided shortly in a 15.0.2 release. .. _bug 1671648: https://launchpad.net/bugs/1671648 critical: - | `Bug 1670627`_ is fixed. This bug led to potential over-quota errors after several failed server build attempts, resulting in quota usage to reach the limit even though the servers were deleted. Unfortunately the ``nova-manage project quota_usage_refresh`` command will not reset the usages to fix this problem once encountered. If the project should not have any outstanding resource usage, then one possible workaround is to delete the existing quota usage for the project:: ``nova quota-delete --tenant <tenant_id>`` That will cleanup the ``project_user_quotas``, ``quota_usages`` and ``reservations`` tables for the given project in the ``nova`` database and reset the quota limits for the project back to the defaults defined in nova.conf. .. _Bug 1670627: https://launchpad.net/bugs/1670627 fixes: - | `Bug 1665263`_ is fixed. This was a regression where ``instance.delete.start`` and ``instance.delete.end`` notifications were not emitted when deleting an instance in ``ERROR`` state due to a failed build. .. _Bug 1665263: https://launchpad.net/bugs/1665263

commit_message:
Disable docker-registry by default

The docker-registry package has been replaced by docker-distribution in
centos and is failing the puppet code that expect a docker-registry
service. A proper patch I89e14cc2a27299ce4c191d2a823deb0424693831 was
submitted to stable/newton and stable/ocata but was a bit too invasive
for mitaka.

Simply changing the default not to install docker-registry should make
the gate happy again.

Change-Id: I9f5599889ac3e56ba201b01340f21fc7e4051df5

Remove custom healthcheck app and use oslo middleware instead

We shouldn't use custom healthcheck instead we should use the oslo
middleware healthcheck.

Removing templates from syntribos repo

As templates and payloads have been moved to respective repos[1],
removing them from syntribos repo.

[1]. openstack/syntribos-payloads,
     openstack/syntribos-openstack-templates

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-13 15:46:22.000000000', 'files': ['labs/osbash/lib/osbash/lib.ubuntu-16.04-server-i386.sh', 'labs/stacktrain/distros/ubuntu_16_04_server_amd64.py', 'labs/osbash/lib/osbash/lib.ubuntu-16.04-server-amd64.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/training-labs/commit/cf09e7c214eafefecf1b76aa1a73859c252a29f3', 'message': 'Fix Ubuntu ISO update: update md5 sums

The previous changeset "Update Ubuntu ISO 16.04.1 to 16.04.2" with
(Change-Id Ie0b93f7cfc3091d82de13fc56d94cae281f84b8a) did not
update the md5 sums, causing the code to delete and redownload
the ISO image for every basedisk build.

Change-Id: I549f79b5268aeed3ae4717a3d8e964a0f9087178
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Ubuntu ISO update: update md5 sums

The previous changeset "Update Ubuntu ISO 16.04.1 to 16.04.2" with
(Change-Id Ie0b93f7cfc3091d82de13fc56d94cae281f84b8a) did not
update the md5 sums, causing the code to delete and redownload
the ISO image for every basedisk build.

Change-Id: I549f79b5268aeed3ae4717a3d8e964a0f9087178
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/training-labs refs/changes/57/444957/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add Python 3.5 classifier and venv

Now that there is a passing gate job, we can claim
support for Python 3.5 in the classifier.
This patch also adds the convenience py35 venv.

Change-Id: I0f4fc86c01e40ac577d472ec7c53b3c218d7383c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-brick-cinderclient-ext refs/changes/03/390603/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Allow ELEMENTS_DIR to be configurable
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-14 15:57:09.000000000', 'files': ['bin/dib-lint'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder/commit/02e5353a9fd5bba77162d6eff43c22917773da3d', 'message': "Allow ELEMENTS_DIR to be configurable

Prior to version 2.0.0 of diskimage-builder, the elements dir was hard
coded as 'elements' in dib-lint which allowed dib-lint to be consumed by
other projects (instack-undercloud). The 2.0.0 release has changed this
path and it is not overridable so that the other projects can still use
dib-lint. This change makes ELEMENTS_DIR and LIB_DIR check for an
existing environment variable so that dib-lint can be consumed outside
of the diskimage-builder project.

Change-Id: Iae1dade1e20a950e63ffe8dacfea0f23cf9923a0
Related-Bug: #1672730
"}]
commit_message:
Allow ELEMENTS_DIR to be configurable

Prior to version 2.0.0 of diskimage-builder, the elements dir was hard
coded as 'elements' in dib-lint which allowed dib-lint to be consumed by
other projects (instack-undercloud). The 2.0.0 release has changed this
path and it is not overridable so that the other projects can still use
dib-lint. This change makes ELEMENTS_DIR and LIB_DIR check for an
existing environment variable so that dib-lint can be consumed outside
of the diskimage-builder project.

Change-Id: Iae1dade1e20a950e63ffe8dacfea0f23cf9923a0
Related-Bug: #1672730
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/45/445545/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Add mkfs.vfat to nova-compute source images
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-12 19:31:34.000000000', 'files': ['docker/nova/nova-compute/Dockerfile.j2'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla/commit/76cae7fe0bb4cfef0fbd1eb232098e7b1e6775eb', 'message': 'Add mkfs.vfat to nova-compute source images

Currently Windows and non-declared os_type images (defaults
to Windows) attempt to format ephemeral volumes with
mkfs.vfat but fail as this tool is not available in the
container.

This is resolved by installing dosfstools on the Source
builds (as I believe this is handled in binary builds
through dependencies).

Change-Id: Iefa5fb0a16eed30aea935268f2a9becb1481b018
Closes-bug: #1672199
Signed-off-by: Dave Walker (Daviey) <email@daviey.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add mkfs.vfat to nova-compute source images

Currently Windows and non-declared os_type images (defaults
to Windows) attempt to format ephemeral volumes with
mkfs.vfat but fail as this tool is not available in the
container.

This is resolved by installing dosfstools on the Source
builds (as I believe this is handled in binary builds
through dependencies).

Change-Id: Iefa5fb0a16eed30aea935268f2a9becb1481b018
Closes-bug: #1672199
Signed-off-by: Dave Walker (Daviey) <email@daviey.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/65/444665/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Propose Deployment Working Group (DWG)

Proposes the creation of a Deployment Working Group.

This group would collaborate on solving common challenges across all
Deployment tools part of OpenStack community.

Change-Id: I1d42b8eea30d2a55fc3aff93d3c88eefcadf7913
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/governance refs/changes/61/442761/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ========================================= 2016-03-02 Deployment Working Group (DWG) ========================================= OpenStack community has been a welcoming place for Deployment tools. They bring an high value to OpenStack because most of them are used to deploy OpenStack in production, outside classic development environment. Over the last years, Deployment tools projects have been tried to solve similar challenges and we've recently seen some desire to collaborate between the tools, to work on common topics, needed by all these tools. Some examples of collaboration: * OpenStack Ansible and Puppet OpenStack have been collaborating on Continuous Integration scenarios but also on Nova upgrades orchestration. * TripleO and Kolla share the same tool for container builds. * TripleO and Fuel share the same Puppet OpenStack modules. * OpenStack Kubernetes is interested to collaborate on configuration management. * Most of tools want to collect OpenStack parameters for configuration management in a common fashion. The big tent helped to make these projects part of OpenStack, but no official group was created to share common problems across tools until now. During the Atlanta Project Team Gathering in 2017 [1]_, most of current active deployment tools project team leaders met in a room and decided to start actual collaboration on different topics. This resolution is a first iteration of creating a new working group for Deployment Tools. The Deployment Working Group Mission would be the following:: To bring the experience of different groups using different tools to solve the same problems in a common group that would make abstraction of the deployment tool technology and think at resolving common challenges in a collaborative way. In some cases, some challenges will be solved by adopting a technology or a tool. But sometimes, it won't happen because of the deployment tool background. This group would have to figure out how we can increase this adoption and converge to the same technologies eventually. References ========== .. [1] http

subject: Decrement quota usage when deleting an instance in cell0
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-13 22:49:00.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/functional/regressions/test_bug_1670627.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_api.py', 'nova/compute/api.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/f8c2df78f2ff8b58d72e55391b02ae8c6faa4bc1', 'message': "Decrement quota usage when deleting an instance in cell0

When we fail to schedule an instance, e.g. there are no hosts
available, conductor creates the instance in the cell0 database
and deletes the build request. At this point quota usage
has been incremented in the main 'nova' database.

When the instance is deleted, the build request is already gone
so _delete_while_booting returns False and we lookup the instance
in cell0 and delete it from there, but that flow wasn't decrementing
quota usage like _delete_while_booting was.

This change adds the same quota usage decrement handling that
_delete_while_booting performs.

NOTE(mriedem): This change also pulls in some things from
I7de87dce216835729283bca69f0eff59a679b624 which is not being
backported to Ocata since in Pike it solves a slightly different
part of this quota usage issue. In Pike the cell mapping db_connection
is actually stored on the context object when we get the instance
from nova.compute.api.API.get(). So the fix in Pike is slightly
different from Ocata. However, what we need to pull from that Pike
change is:

1. We need to target the cell that the instance lives in to get the
   flavor information when creating the quota reservation.

2. We need to change the functional regression test to assert that
   the bug is fixed.

The code and tests are adjusted to be a sort of mix between both
changes in Pike without requiring a full backport of the 2nd
part of the fix in Pike.

Change-Id: I4cb0169ce0de537804ab9129bc671d75ce5f7953
Partial-Bug: #1670627
(cherry picked from commit 018068c4caac324643c7c6a4360fad855dd096eb)
"}]
commit_message:
Decrement quota usage when deleting an instance in cell0

When we fail to schedule an instance, e.g. there are no hosts
available, conductor creates the instance in the cell0 database
and deletes the build request. At this point quota usage
has been incremented in the main 'nova' database.

When the instance is deleted, the build request is already gone
so _delete_while_booting returns False and we lookup the instance
in cell0 and delete it from there, but that flow wasn't decrementing
quota usage like _delete_while_booting was.

This change adds the same quota usage decrement handling that
_delete_while_booting performs.

NOTE(mriedem): This change also pulls in some things from
I7de87dce216835729283bca69f0eff59a679b624 which is not being
backported to Ocata since in Pike it solves a slightly different
part of this quota usage issue. In Pike the cell mapping db_connection
is actually stored on the context object when we get the instance
from nova.compute.api.API.get(). So the fix in Pike is slightly
different from Ocata. However, what we need to pull from that Pike
change is:

1. We need to target the cell that the instance lives in to get the
   flavor information when creating the quota reservation.

2. We need to change the functional regression test to assert that
   the bug is fixed.

The code and tests are adjusted to be a sort of mix between both
changes in Pike without requiring a full backport of the 2nd
part of the fix in Pike.

Change-Id: I4cb0169ce0de537804ab9129bc671d75ce5f7953
Partial-Bug: #1670627
(cherry picked from commit 018068c4caac324643c7c6a4360fad855dd096eb)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/36/445236/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Conductor may have buried the instance in cell0 but # quotas must still be decremented in the main cell DB. project_id, user_id = quotas_obj.ids_from_instance( context, instance) # We have to get the flavor from the instance while the # context is still targeted to where the instance lives. with nova_context.target_cell(context, cell): quota_flavor = self._get_flavor_for_reservation( instance) # This is confusing but actually decrements quota usage. quotas = self._create_reservations(context, instance, instance.task_state, project_id, user_id, flavor=quota_flavor) quotas.commit() try: with nova_context.target_cell(context, cell): with compute_utils.notify_about_instance_delete( self.notifier, context, instance): instance.destroy() return except exception.InstanceNotFound: quotas.rollback() def _get_flavor_for_reservation(self, instance): """Returns the flavor needed for _create_reservations. This is used when the context is targeted to a cell that is different from the one that the instance lives in. """ if instance.task_state in (task_states.RESIZE_MIGRATED, task_states.RESIZE_FINISH): return instance.old_flavor return instance.flavor project_id, user_id, flavor=None): old_flavor = flavor or instance.old_flavor flavor = flavor or instance.flavor instance_vcpus = flavor.vcpus instance_memory_mb = flavor.memory_mb
deleted_lines: with nova_context.target_cell(context, cell): with compute_utils.notify_about_instance_delete( self.notifier, context, instance): instance.destroy() return project_id, user_id): old_flavor = instance.old_flavor instance_vcpus = instance.flavor.vcpus instance_memory_mb = instance.flavor.memory_mb

commit_message:
Add regression test for bug 1670627

This adds a functional regression test for bug 1670627.

This is the recreate scenario. Patches that are proposed to
fix the bug will build on top of this and change it's assertions
to know when it's properly fixed.

commit_message:
Correctly set up deprecation warning

In the current state, no warning was output in the logs.
With this fix, a warning is output in the logs and the value from
[DEFAULT] is used correctly.

commit_message:
Switch to use stable data_utils

Tempest provides stable library interfaces under tempest.lib.
This patch switches to use it for data_utils.

NOTE: Maybe reviewers will feel deja-vu because the similar patch is
      merged before. But ater that, the another copying tempest patch
      has been merged and we need this patch again. Sorry for this mess.
      Iba05bc604f447f2acaf4cd81e05443b366b821a1 will be merged after
      all projects are ready.

Change-Id: I191fc58418ad4e44dc06da062e2a00566d5140d4

subject: Deprecate glance APIs version config options
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-08 04:25:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/c49c474192e7253c80831b76f112f2caaeca414d', 'message': 'Deprecate glance APIs version config options

Glance v1 APIs are deprecated and v2 are current.
Tempest should tests only v2 APIs and by default v1
APIs are being disabled - I7f962a07317cdad917ee896d79e49ee18938d074

This commit deprecate the API version selection config options

commit_message:
Deprecate glance APIs version config options

Glance v1 APIs are deprecated and v2 are current.
Tempest should tests only v2 APIs and by default v1
APIs are being disabled - I7f962a07317cdad917ee896d79e49ee18938d074

This commit deprecate the API version selection config options
so that we can switch to v2 only testing soon.

Change-Id: I6c4b92f0f2da2797efbb27e16061e6e325dda504

commit_message:
Do not 'enable_plugin networking-generic-switch' in grenade

We don't want to 'enable_plugin networking-generic-switch' in grenade as
it won't work for multi-node jobs.

Change-Id: I30b2088e8e50f697157dcff2841925b75e3f3672

commit_message:
Fixes test_images_member_rbac missing os credentials for image v2.

Currently Patrole test in image.v2.test_images_member_rbac fails
because of an AttributeError [0], related to the attribute 'os'
missing, meaning that the credentials array lacks the 'primary'
user. This patch adds the 'primary' user to the credentials
array for this test.

[0] http://logs.openstack.org/94/444994/4/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-patrole-admin-ubuntu-xenial-nv/370bc2d/console.html

Change-Id: I62050cc8595acb87b49ecb9e9c6ff80503591bc3
Partial-Bug: #1670553

subject: Decrease overall run time when identity auth is set to v3.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-13 16:10:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/patrole/commit/3b20c4fc5213999fee51fa37fd5e7fec0a31c47a', 'message': 'Increase overall run time when identity auth is set to v3.

This patch avoids executing time.sleep(1) in rbac_utils, when
Keystone v3 auth is enabled, which greatly reduces run time
(approximately by 5 min or more). Thus, this patch also changes
post_test_hook to forcibly set Keystone v3 auth in the tempest
gates, so that tests run much faster.

More details about the reasoning for this change may be found
in keystone.keystone.conf.token.allow_rescoped_scoped_token:

"This toggles whether scoped tokens may be be re-scoped to a new
project or domain, thereby preventing users from exchanging a
scoped token (including those with a default project scope) for
any other token. This forces users to either authenticate for
unscoped tokens (and later exchange that unscoped token for
tokens with a more specific scope) or to provide their
credentials in every request for a scoped token to avoid
re-scoping altogether."

Change-Id: I679f75b54bcc61f688f761a6e6f16d4cf0173cb7
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-03-13 19:57:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/patrole/commit/7b74481108eee9c8efc59e5fc7322d81e3a1b810', 'message': 'Increase overall run time when identity auth is set to v3.

This patch avoids executing time.sleep(1) in rbac_utils, when
Keystone v3 auth is enabled, which greatly reduces run time
(approximately by 5 min or more). Thus, this patch also changes
post_test_hook to forcibly set Keystone v3 auth in the tempest
gates, so that tests run much faster.

Currently time.sleep(1) is used to avoid rounding issues with the
"created_at" field when creating a token. This field drops the
milliseconds from the time field. Attempting to use a token before
the time in the "created_at" field results in an error, meaning that
it is necessary to do time.sleep(1). However, with Keystone v3 this
is not the case, so this time.sleep(1) can be avoided with v3, resulting
in much faster overall test execution time.

Change-Id: I679f75b54bcc61f688f761a6e6f16d4cf0173cb7

commit_message:
Decrease overall run time when identity auth is set to v3.

This patch avoids executing time.sleep(1) in rbac_utils, when
Keystone v3 auth is enabled, which greatly reduces run time
(approximately by 5 min or more). Thus, this patch also changes
post_test_hook to forcibly set Keystone v3 auth in the tempest
gates, so that tests run much faster.

Currently time.sleep(1) is used to avoid rounding issues with the
"created_at" field when creating a token. This field drops the
milliseconds from the time field. Attempting to use a token before
the time in the "created_at" field results in an error, meaning that
it is necessary to do time.sleep(1). However, with Keystone v3 this
is not the case, so this time.sleep(1) can be avoided with v3, resulting
in much faster overall test execution time.

Change-Id: I679f75b54bcc61f688f761a6e6f16d4cf0173cb7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/patrole refs/changes/67/444967/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
debian: install gnupg and dirmngr needed for apt-key

Debian/stretch container image does not have them installed so apt-key
calls fail.

Partially-Implements: multiarch-and-arm64-containers

Change-Id: Ia1ca5e62d815a224716074cf81e7d7519f33d6fc

commit_message:
Add port property: trunk_details

Since the introduction of the neutron trunk port feature in newton some
ports (ie. the trunk parent ports) have a new attribute: trunk_details.
Let the openstack sdk know about it.

See also: https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/networking/v2/ \
    ?expanded=show-trunk-details-detail

Change-Id: I7a675f4a1cbd040102174123c354ec4b6a40fad1
Closes-Bug: #1672724

commit_message:
[WIP] Make CentOS run_tests.sh more reliable

When running ./run_tests.sh on CentOS, you have small issues all
the way. It's painful and prevents ppl from properly test the roles
separately.

This should fix small issues that are frequently met.

Change-Id: I00cb54f92654234de2d950797d3d81be566c80ae

commit_message:
bagpipe-bgp: drop support for bagpipe-bgp --log-file

This was used in bagpipe-bgp to specific a logging
*configuration* rather than a log file, but does not
play well at all with oslo.log habits.

Change-Id: Icdc50c68c9bb279e4a646990e632788b294ff688

subject: Switch to admin role during client set up to fix some gate bugs.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-14 15:57:10.000000000', 'files': ['patrole_tempest_plugin/tests/api/orchestration/rbac_base.py', 'patrole_tempest_plugin/tests/api/identity/v2/rbac_base.py', 'patrole_tempest_plugin/tests/api/network/rbac_base.py', 'patrole_tempest_plugin/tests/api/volume/rbac_base.py', 'patrole_tempest_plugin/tests/api/image/rbac_base.py', 'patrole_tempest_plugin/tests/api/compute/rbac_base.py', 'patrole_tempest_plugin/tests/api/identity/v3/rbac_base.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/patrole/commit/61b90493ffb0f13b8159e6d8757608927c927e5e', 'message': 'Switch to admin role during client set up to fix some gate bugs.

The current framework only adds the admin role to
the cls.os.<client-name> namespace when switchToRbacRole=False
is executed; meaning that the first test that is executed
in a test run will not have the admin role during set up.

Thus, it is necessary to add a switch_role with
switchToRbacRole=False to setup_clients (after rbac_utils
is instantiated), so that class-level resources are set
up with admin credentials. This is why
test_flavor_extra_specs_rbac is currently failing [0].
(setup_clients is called before resource_setup.)

This patch:
  * Performs switchToRbacRole=False in the setup_clients
    of every base Patrole test class.

[0] http://logs.openstack.org/94/444994/2/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-patrole-admin-ubuntu-xenial-nv/a00e22a/console.html

Change-Id: I8027938daa4fdfff0ac5336324aa6d647322237b
Partial-Bug: #1670553
'}]
commit_message:
Switch to admin role during client set up to fix some gate bugs.

The current framework only adds the admin role to
the cls.os.<client-name> namespace when switchToRbacRole=False
is executed; meaning that the first test that is executed
in a test run will not have the admin role during set up.

Thus, it is necessary to add a switch_role with
switchToRbacRole=False to setup_clients (after rbac_utils
is instantiated), so that class-level resources are set
up with admin credentials. This is why
test_flavor_extra_specs_rbac is currently failing [0].
(setup_clients is called before resource_setup.)

This patch:
  * Performs switchToRbacRole=False in the setup_clients
    of every base Patrole test class.

[0] http://logs.openstack.org/94/444994/2/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-patrole-admin-ubuntu-xenial-nv/a00e22a/console.html

Change-Id: I8027938daa4fdfff0ac5336324aa6d647322237b
Partial-Bug: #1670553

commit_message:
Fix the pep8 fixing

First patchset for the override_folder worked functionally but
failed at pep8. I fixed the pep8 and broke the functionality at
the same time.

This should fix it.

Change-Id: I40542695c72e5be7799422f265f00c0b6d68ef0e

commit_message:
tripleo: implement experimental scenario006

TripleO CI wants to test OpenStack with Ceph replication managed by
puppet-ceph. Therefore, we would like a job that will deploy a 2-nodes
overcloud, where Ceph is configured to replicate objects.

This job would be experimental at first, and only run on Pike (current
master) and beyond; and only when we try to patch ceph files in TripleO.

Change-Id: I5384f64e39b8cca982afa2cc5733964b03fb453f

commit_message:
Switch tests to use latest etcd - 3.1.3

Let's move on to newer releases of etcd. Especially since
3.1.x introduced some backwards incompatible changes

https://github.com/coreos/etcd/releases

Change-Id: I3887dbb745fb6de844c4b60d43b6543f441f239b

commit_message:
Split debootstrap into debootstrap-minimal

Break out the usage of debootstrap into its own minimal element. This
allows users who want to create even more minimal footprints; built
just atop of packages that debootstrap installs.

Change-Id: Id68ac0e148bbce01de6cc9d9df9b3267bd8b9ceb
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Adding OpenStack templates for nova & neutron

Adding nova & neutron templates to the new repo
after it has been decided in the last cycle to keep
the templates and payloads independent of the main
repo in order to package syntribos.

Change-Id: I0d237cc2f216616efae065e2e3c3d972b348e72c

commit_message:
Glance V1 is deprecated and removed in devstack
Removes reference to glance API for OpenStack CLI
Implements: OpenStack CLI
Closes-Bug: 1672535
